Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Payrails

Payrails is a global payment software company helping leading enterprises to take control of their payment operations and maximize performance. With deep experience in the payments space and firsthand knowledge of merchants' challenges, we‚Äôve seen how fragmented, complex, and inefficient these systems can become. Now, we are setting a new industry standard for how enterprises around the world manage and optimize payments, with more control, visibility and flexibility than ever before.

Our vision is to reimagine payments from the ground up. We are building a deeply integrated meta layer that spans the entire payment lifecycle with a modular architecture. This helps us give leading brands building blocks to craft solutions to most complex operational challenges, tailor seamless customer experiences and grow their business.

We are backed by some of the world‚Äôs top investors including Andreessen Horowitz, HV Capital, EQT Ventures and General Catalyst, who share our mission to simplify payment complexity globally.

At Payrails, we‚Äôre committed to building a team of exceptional people - not just talented, but driven to build, solve, and deliver at the highest level. Excellence isn‚Äôt just a value here; it‚Äôs a way of working. We believe that great people thrive in environments where there‚Äôs trust, clarity, and shared purpose. We work openly and collaboratively, with deep respect for each other‚Äôs craft. Everyone is encouraged to understand the bigger picture - what we‚Äôre building, why it matters, and what stands in the way. When people have that context, they move faster, take ownership, and make better decisions. We care about creating a culture where people feel inspired to do their best work and a deep sense of responsibility to help us bring our vision to life. Success at Payrails means staying focused on the problems that matter most, and executing with purpose.

Your team

At Payrails, data is at the core of everything we do. We don‚Äôt just analyze data; we turn it into actionable insights that fuel smarter decision-making and drive the future of our products. As we continue to revolutionize the payments industry we are seeking an exceptional Senior Data Analyst to help us in our mission.

Our Data Team is at the forefront of driving transformation, empowering every department to unlock the full potential of data

How you will make an impact


Develop and optimize dashboards and reporting to empower data-driven decision-making across marketing, sales, product, and operations.
Perform ad-hoc and deep-dive analyses that uncover actionable insights and influence strategic decisions across go-to-market and product initiatives.
Improve, extend, and maintain DBT data models and curated datasets, enabling reliable and scalable self-service analytics.
Partner closely with stakeholders to define and align on core business and marketing metrics and KPIs.
Collaborate with the data platform team to ensure data quality, reliability, and scalability.
Contribute to a high-performing analytics culture by sharing best practices, guiding on data literacy, and mentoring peers where needed.


What we are looking for


5+ years of professional experience in analytics, business intelligence, or related data roles, with significant exposure to marketing analytics.
Advanced SQL skills and proven experience with modern cloud data warehouses (preferably Snowflake).
Hands-on experience with DBT (or similar tools) for data modeling and transformations.
Proficiency in Python for data analysis, automation, or integration tasks.
Experience with BI and visualization tools (GoodData, Tableau, Looker, Mode, or similar).
Solid understanding of data modeling concepts and best practices.
Familiarity with statistical methods (e.g., hypothesis testing, regression, attribution modeling, multivariate testing).
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate technical findings into clear business insights.
Strong analytical mindset, natural curiosity, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Ability to work independently, take ownership, and drive results in a fast-paced, evolving environment.


What we offer


High impact and high velocity environment with the most talented and ambitious people you will ever work with
A chance to shape the story of a company and a category from the ground up
Real ownership. You‚Äôll have the freedom and trust to build, test, and take lead
A product used by the best brands around the world
Visa and relocation support for you and your family where required
Hybrid working with an office in the heart of Berlin
Regular team events, activities and off-sites
Discounted Urban Sports Club membership
Competitive salary and equity package
27 days of annual paid vacation

Dein Profil

Sehr gute SQL-Kenntnisse (inkl. komplexer Joins, CTEs, Window Functions, Performance-Tuning).

Was Du bei uns erwarten kannst

einen strukturierten Start: individuelles Onboarding, organisiertes Networking

Corporate Benefits), Pr√§mien (z.B. zur Hochzeit, Geburt, Jubil√§um), Aktienbeteiligung Schneider Electric, Mitarbeiterevents (Teamevents, Sommerfeste, ‚Ä¶), je nach Standort: Tischkicker/ Tischtennisplatte/ Hunde geduldet, Gesundheitsmanagement (z.B. Verg√ºnstigungen im Sportstudio, Betriebsarzt, ‚Ä¶),...
ein modernes Arbeitszeitmodell: Vertrauensarbeitszeit, flexible Arbeitszeiten, M√∂glichkeit hybrid zu arbeiten
Karriereentwicklung/ -perspektiven: Team- bzw. Rollenbasierte Weiterentwicklung/ Trainings, individuelle Weiterentwicklung/ Trainings, nationale und internationale Karriereperspektiven innerhalb der RIB-Gruppe oder Schneider Electric, ‚Ä¶
deinen Raum f√ºr Gestaltungsm√∂glichkeiten: proaktives Teilen deiner Ideen/ Ans√§tze/ Prozessoptimierungen innerhalb des Teams, betriebliches Ideenmanagement, aktive Beteiligung an Meetings auf Team und Managementebene (‚ÄûRIB Town Halls‚Äú), ‚Ä¶
Wege, wie du nachhaltig sein kannst (je nach Standort & Funktion): digitale Infrastruktur, Company-Bikes, Fahrtkostenzuschuss, eAuto als Firmenwagen


UNTERNEHMENSKULTUR UND WERTE

Motiviert durch unsere Werte kreieren wir eine corporate culture, in der wir ein klares Bild davon haben, wie wir miteinander interact, kommunizieren, arbeiten, f√ºhren/ coachen, supporten und unseren Nachwuchs f√∂rdern. Dabei steht immer der Mensch im Vordergrund!

CHANCENGLEICHHEIT UND DIVERSITY

RIB f√∂rdert die Chancengleichheit von Frauen und M√§nnern in allen Funktionen und T√§tigkeitsfeldern.

Ganz gleich ob weibliche F√ºhrungskr√§fte, Mitarbeitende mit Behinderung, Berufseinsteigenden oder √§ltere Berufserfahrene ‚Äì f√ºr uns z√§hlt Engagement und die richtige Qualifikation. RIB VISION

Geb√§ude und Bauten sind f√ºr 36% des weltweiten Energieverbrauchs und fast 40% der energiebedingten CO2-Emissionen verantwortlich. Um die Branche effizienter, robuster und nachhaltiger zu machen, entwickeln wir Softwarel√∂sungen, mit denen man im gesamten Lebenszyklus eines Bauwerks Ressourcen, Rohstoffe und Energie einsparen kann. Digitalisierung sehen wir als einen Treiber f√ºr eine nachhaltige Bauindustrie. "Building Better Together" steht dabei f√ºr das Zusammenspiel der beiden weltweit f√ºhrenden Prozess- und Energietechnologien: RIB-Gruppe und Schneider Electric.

Corporate Benefits), Pr√§mien (z.B. zur Hochzeit, Geburt, Jubil√§um), Aktienbeteiligung Schneider Electric, Mitarbeiterevents (Teamevents, Sommerfeste, ‚Ä¶), je nach Standort: Tischkicker/ Tischtennisplatte/ Hunde geduldet, Gesundheitsmanagement (z.B. Verg√ºnstigungen im Sportstudio, Betriebsarzt, ‚Ä¶),...
  • ein modernes Arbeitszeitmodell: Vertrauensarbeitszeit, flexible Arbeitszeiten, M√∂glichkeit hybrid zu arbeiten
  • Karriereentwicklung/ -perspektiven: Team- bzw. Rollenbasierte Weiterentwicklung/ Trainings, individuelle Weiterentwicklung/ Trainings, nationale und internationale Karriereperspektiven innerhalb der RIB-Gruppe oder Schneider Electric, ‚Ä¶
  • deinen Raum f√ºr Gestaltungsm√∂glichkeiten: proaktives Teilen deiner Ideen/ Ans√§tze/ Prozessoptimierungen innerhalb des Teams, betriebliches Ideenmanagement, aktive Beteiligung an Meetings auf Team und Managementebene (‚ÄûRIB Town Halls‚Äú), ‚Ä¶
  • Wege, wie du nachhaltig sein kannst (je nach Standort & Funktion): digitale Infrastruktur, Company-Bikes, Fahrtkostenzuschuss, eAuto als Firmenwagen

UNTERNEHMENSKULTUR UND WERTE

Motiviert durch unsere Werte kreieren wir eine corporate culture, in der wir ein klares Bild davon haben, wie wir miteinander interact, kommunizieren, arbeiten, f√ºhren/ coachen, supporten und unseren Nachwuchs f√∂rdern. Dabei steht immer der Mensch im Vordergrund!

CHANCENGLEICHHEIT UND DIVERSITY

RIB f√∂rdert die Chancengleichheit von Frauen und M√§nnern in allen Funktionen und T√§tigkeitsfeldern.

Ganz gleich ob weibliche F√ºhrungskr√§fte, Mitarbeitende mit Behinderung, Berufseinsteigenden oder √§ltere Berufserfahrene ‚Äì f√ºr uns z√§hlt Engagement und die richtige Qualifikation. Der RIB Code of Conduct beschreibt dabei unsere wichtigsten Prinzipien in puncto Nationalit√§t, ethnischer Herkunft, Religion,‚Ä¶

RIB VISION

Geb√§ude und Bauten sind f√ºr 36% des weltweiten Energieverbrauchs und fast 40% der energiebedingten CO2-Emissionen verantwortlich. Um die Branche effizienter, robuster und nachhaltiger zu machen, entwickeln wir Softwarel√∂sungen, mit denen man im gesamten Lebenszyklus eines Bauwerks Ressourcen, Rohstoffe und Energie einsparen kann. Digitalisierung sehen wir als einen Treiber f√ºr eine nachhaltige Bauindustrie. "Building Better Together" steht dabei f√ºr das Zusammenspiel der beiden weltweit f√ºhrenden Prozess- und Energietechnologien: RIB-Gruppe und Schneider Electric.

Unser Manifest beschreibt unsere √úberzeugungen und Werte, die uns bei unserer Arbeit antreiben und uns gemeinsam zu H√∂chstleistungen inspirieren: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lfqlC37lhzk

https://www.rib-software.com/group/impressum

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì Sales Steering and Analytics
Description:
This Challenge Awaits You

You will shape the future of data-driven sales at IAV and lay the foundation for data-based decisions with your work. With your expertise in data architecture, reporting, and AI-supported applications, you will create transparency across our sales pipeline and strengthen the organization's strategic control capabilities. You will play a key role in ensuring that our sales team can rely on reliable data ‚Äì for greater efficiency, impact, and sustainability.

Your Tasks


You define standards for quality assurance in the sales pipeline and ensure reliable, high-quality sales data as a basis for strategic and operational decisions
You continuously develop CRM and dashboard solutions in collaboration with IT and drive the implementation of strategic measures to improve the IT and reporting landscape
You harmonize data processes and are responsible for their technical design.
You evaluate and integrate AI-based functions to increase efficiency in CRM systems.
You ensure high data quality through consistent data architecture


Necessary Skills


Degree in (business) information technology, data analysis, mathematics, or a related field
In-depth knowledge of data analysis and IT
Good technical knowledge of sales and reporting tools such as SAC and Microsoft Dynamics
Experience in translating technical requirements into technical solutions, particularly in the CRM and reporting environment
Competence in working with IT teams
Very good knowledge of German (at least C1 level) and good knowledge of English (at least B2 level)


Desired Skills


You think in terms of system logic and develop solutions with a high degree of automation.
You have experience with AI-supported sales applications and their data requirements.
You are confident in acting as the interface between IT and sales.
You work in a structured and independent manner and strive for technical excellence


Take on responsibility instead of being a cog in the wheel. At IAV, we‚Äôll entrust ever more important tasks to you, step by step. Thanks to professional mentors, you won‚Äôt be alone and will be able to grow with your projects. You‚Äôll work together with the big names in the mobility and research world. And you can acquire additional qualifications through e.g. in-house seminars or at conferences.

Diversity and equal opportunity are important to us. What matters to us is the individual, with his or her character and strengths.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
The role

We are seeking a driven and ambitious Data Analyst to join our growing Data Analytics team, based in Berlin. Our team provides support across all teams like Product, Sales and Operations by developing insights and enabling analytical and automated decision making. We build strong partnerships with key stakeholders and work on challenges such as defining, implementing and tracking company-wide metrics, and leading initiatives to improve them

Zenjob is on the mission to become the digital staffing platform delivering companies best staffing experience with the highest flexibility and reliability, and workers the best choice and fair pay for side jobs. Our service is available in over 39 cities in Germany. Our growth financing round of $50 million (‚Ç¨45 million) from February 2022 is helping us to scale our platform and add new data-based automation features for our rapidly growing customer base.

What you'll be doing:

Requirements gathering


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and define data analytical requirements that will help driving business initiatives
Define KPIs, success and health metrics in the context of product and business initiatives


Data collection and preparation:


Identify relevant data sources and work with data engineers and tracking experts to source the right data into the analytics environment
Prepare data to make it suitable for the analysis in context


Data exploration and analysis:


Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and insights
Utilize statistical methods to extract actionable information from data
Develop and maintain core data models to support business analysts


Experimentation


Support stakeholders during the hypothesis formulation and validation phase
With the collaboration of the data science and engineering teams, design and implement experiments around upcoming product features


Visualization and reporting


Design and create effective data visualizations to communicate insights and trends
Hands-on experience with traditional BI tools (Tableau, Metabase) and, ideally, product analytics tools (Indicative) as well


Communication and collaboration


Communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and nontechnical audiences
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business analysts, data engineers, and product managers and decision makers
Provide training and support to end users for interpreting and using data visualizations in a self-service manner effectively


What you'll bring


5-+ years of relevant experience interpreting data as an analyst or equivalent
High proficiency in querying and modeling data using Python and SQL
Ability to translate a business question into an analytical requirement considering its context: what the business is trying to achieve, the processes around it, the systems that interact and the data points available
Analyze the results of A/B-test experiments and derive conclusions or new hypothesis the business can follow up on
Great communication skills in stakeholder management from diverse backgrounds
Great communication skills in storytelling capable of creating a consistent narrative that gives meaning to the numbers
Extensive experience using different data visualization and reporting tools
Experience on analytics engineering using dbt is highly desirable
Plus: experience with experimentation platforms (eg. ABSmartly, Optimizely) and product analytical tools (eg. Indicative, Amplitude)


What we offer:


A supportive, open, and fun team that will have your back from day 1.
Twenty-eight days of vacation (increases based on tenure to up to 30 days), 1-day special leave paid for charity work, five days of paid educational leave, and the option of unpaid leave.
Hybrid work setup combining office & remote work (3 days from office, 2 days home), flexible working hours, bring your dog policy.
Ongoing focus on your personal development (annual development budget of EUR 750, mentoring opportunities, continuous career conversations)
Mental Health support via Likeminded
Monthly 30 EUR subsidy on Urban Sports Club, 25% discount on FitX gym membership
Monthly 40 EUR credit for NAVIT- a sustainable mobility solution spanning public transport bike-sharing.
Tax-free meal allowance (saving EUR ~50 net per month!)
Quarterly team get togethers, budget for employees birthdays, winter & summer parties plus regular cultural talks & events


If this sounds exciting to you, then we'd love to find out more about you! Apply and send in your application.

Life at Zenjob revolves around innovation, collaboration, and growth. Check out our video for a glimpse into what it's like to be part of our team: Link to Video üé•

We invite you to explore our Career Page, follow our LinkedIn page, and connect with us on Instagram.

We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to assessing every qualified person according to their skills, regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status or religion. It is not necessary to include your photo and age with your application.
Show more

Title: Staff Product Analyst, Adtech
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Adtech tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

We work on developing digital advertising solutions for our vendors. Currently, these solutions are available on our food ordering platform, both on mobile and the web. The Ad Tech solutions support the vendors in all three steps of the marketing funnel: awareness, consideration, and conversion enabling them to achieve sustainable growth on our platform.

A Product Analyst in the Ad Tech organization plays a pivotal role in enabling data-driven decision-making. You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define and implement tracking requirements, set up A/B tests, analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights on the performance of different revenue streams, and communicate the results to relevant stakeholders.

You will be a critical member in defining the product strategy and the continued success of our brands.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!


Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions
Develop in-depth analytical understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Leverage insights from data by providing analyses, reports and dashboards for product management and other departments
Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business, providing insights to help product managers, designers, and engineers to decide which features to build and why
Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources and different products


Qualifications


Overall 6+ years of experience, preferably in e-commerce
You've completed a degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science or an equivalent education or possess relevant practical experience
Very good communication skills in English, both written and oral
Data Analysis: Strong experience in SQL (BigQuery) and Python (alternatively R)
A/B Testing: Experience designing experiments and analyzing results with a solid background in statistics
Data Visualization Technologies: Preferably Tableau or similar alternatives e.g. Looker, QlikView, etc.


Nice to have:


Tracking Technologies: Google Analytics or similar alternatives e.g. Adobe Analytics/Omniture, SnowPlow, etc.
Industry expertise in advertising and/or marketing.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Business Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
_

√úber uns

Wer wir sind und was wir tun. Wir unterst√ºtzen unsere Kunden dabei, ihre Prozesse und damit ihre Organisation zu digitalisieren. Diese Ver√§nderung verstehen wir als ganzheitliche Aufgabe, die alle Organisationseinheiten und Hierarchiestufen einschlie√üt. Dazu agieren wir als verl√§sslicher Partner auf Augenh√∂he, der seine Kunden mit technologischer, betriebswirtschaftlicher und kommunikativer Kompetenz durch den digitalen Wandel begleitet.

Unsere Kultur und Grunds√§tze. Was wir tun, muss uns Freude machen - zu jedem Zeitpunkt. Wir nehmen nur Projekte an, die uns im positiven Sinne herausfordern und weiterbringen. Jede Zusammenarbeit ist von einem Miteinander auf Augenh√∂he gepr√§gt - im internen wie externen Team. Kompetenz schl√§gt Hierarchie - immer. Wir gehen offen miteinander um und leben Transparenz.

Deine und unsere Motivation. Daten normalisieren, aggregieren und visualisieren war schon immer Dein Ding? Dashboards zu erstellen f√ºr das Controlling findest Du prima? Automatisierung von Gesch√§ftsprozessen ist genau Deine Denkweise? Dann passt Du zu uns. Um gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden noch erfolgreicher zu sein, suchen wir einen Business Data Analyst (w/m/d).

_

Das macht Deinen Job aus

Deine Aufgaben. Du erfasst und entwickelst gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden und Beratern das, was unsere Kunden in den Bereichen Business Analysis/ Business Intelligence/ Controlling/ Data Analysis/ Data Analytics/ Data Engineering/ Data Intelligence/ Data Management/ Data Science/ Data Warehouse ben√∂tigen.

Deine Aufgaben im Einzelnen. Erfassen der Ausgangssituation/ von Use Cases. Zusammen mit Entwicklern Daten-/ ETL-Pipelines bauen. Datenverarbeitung. Datenmodellierung und Data Relations definieren. Abstimmen und Erstellen von Dashboards/ Reports. Training und Support von Key-Usern, Auswerten und Interpretieren von Daten.

Dein Bereich. Die Position ist dem Bereich ‚ÄûConsulting‚Äú zugeordnet. Deine F√ºhrungskraft ist vom Fach. Sie kann Dir fachkompetent R√ºckmeldung und Unterst√ºtzung geben.

Ber√ºhrungs- und Kontaktpunkte. Du hast regelm√§√üig Kontakt zu Kunden sowie zu Kolleginnen und Kollegen aus anderen Bereichen. Die Kollegen aus dem Bereich Softwareentwicklung unterst√ºtzen Dich gerne beim Entwickeln und Anbinden notwendiger Schnittstellen.

Reiset√§tigkeit. Du kannst viele Aufgaben virtuell machen. Du arbeitest rund 1 Tag/ Monat vor Ort bei Kunden.

_

Das bringst Du mit

Fachlich/ methodisch. Erfahrung als IT-Berater/ Dienstleister f√ºr externe Kunden, idealerweise externe Kunden in den Funktionen GF, Controlling/ kaufm√§nnische Bereiche. Erfahrung im Bereich Automatisierung, Analyse und Visualisierung von Gesch√§ftsdaten. Erfahrung mit einem Tool zur Gesch√§ftsanalyse und zur Darstellung von Gesch√§ftsdaten aus verschiedenen Datenquellen, z.B. MS Power BI, Grafana, Qlik, Tableau. Erfahrung mit Datenbanksystemen, z.B. MySQL, MS SQL.

Qualifikation. Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Betriebswirtschaftslehre oder vergleichbare Qualifikation. Quereinsteiger, Fachfremde und Autodidakten mit entsprechender Berufserfahrung willkommen.

Pers√∂nlich/ sozial. Hohes Ma√ü an Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Selbstst√§ndigkeit. Interdisziplin√§res und agiles Mindset. Einsatzbereitschaft und Teamf√§higkeit.

Deutschkenntnisse. C2 oder muttersprachliches Niveau in Wort und Schrift.

_

Das bieten wir Dir

Wir m√∂chten Dir gerne ein individuelles Angebot machen. Dies k√∂nnen wir erst, wenn wir Dich kennengelernt haben. Bis dahin teilen wir gerne unsere Angebots-Standards mit Dir.

Unternehmen. Wir sind ein etabliertes und wachsendes Unternehmen. Du kannst die Entwicklung des Unternehmens mitgestalten und miterleben.

Aufgaben. Du hast vielf√§ltige M√∂glichkeiten, bei unseren Kunden und uns einen Unterschied zu machen und Wirkung zu erzielen.

Standort, Lage und Infrastruktur. Du kannst unsere B√ºros gut mit dem Auto, √∂V und dem Fahrrad erreichen. F√ºr den √∂V bekommst Du ein Jobticket. Superm√§rkte, Restaurants, Fitness-Studio etc. sind fu√ül√§ufig erreichbar.

Kultur. Wir haben eine offene Kultur mit Raum f√ºr Deine Ideen. Weitere Informationen zu unserer Kultur sowie Mitarbeiterstimmen findest Du auf unserer Karriereseite https://www.anders-ganz.de/karriere/.

HTML:
_

√úber uns

Wer wir sind und was wir tun. Wir unterst√ºtzen unsere Kunden dabei, ihre Prozesse und damit ihre Organisation zu digitalisieren. Diese Ver√§nderung verstehen wir als ganzheitliche Aufgabe, die alle Organisationseinheiten und Hierarchiestufen einschlie√üt. Dazu agieren wir als verl√§sslicher Partner auf Augenh√∂he, der seine Kunden mit technologischer, betriebswirtschaftlicher und kommunikativer Kompetenz durch den digitalen Wandel begleitet.

Unsere Kultur und Grunds√§tze. Was wir tun, muss uns Freude machen - zu jedem Zeitpunkt. Wir nehmen nur Projekte an, die uns im positiven Sinne herausfordern und weiterbringen. Jede Zusammenarbeit ist von einem Miteinander auf Augenh√∂he gepr√§gt - im internen wie externen Team. Kompetenz schl√§gt Hierarchie - immer. Wir gehen offen miteinander um und leben Transparenz.

Deine und unsere Motivation. Daten normalisieren, aggregieren und visualisieren war schon immer Dein Ding? Dashboards zu erstellen f√ºr das Controlling findest Du prima? Automatisierung von Gesch√§ftsprozessen ist genau Deine Denkweise? Dann passt Du zu uns. Um gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden noch erfolgreicher zu sein, suchen wir einen Business Data Analyst (w/m/d).

_

Das macht Deinen Job aus

Deine Aufgaben. Du erfasst und entwickelst gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden und Beratern das, was unsere Kunden in den Bereichen Business Analysis/ Business Intelligence/ Controlling/ Data Analysis/ Data Analytics/ Data Engineering/ Data Intelligence/ Data Management/ Data Science/ Data Warehouse ben√∂tigen.

Deine Aufgaben im Einzelnen. Erfassen der Ausgangssituation/ von Use Cases. Zusammen mit Entwicklern Daten-/ ETL-Pipelines bauen. Datenverarbeitung. Datenmodellierung und Data Relations definieren. Abstimmen und Erstellen von Dashboards/ Reports. Training und Support von Key-Usern, Auswerten und Interpretieren von Daten.

Dein Bereich. Die Position ist dem Bereich ‚ÄûConsulting‚Äú zugeordnet. Deine F√ºhrungskraft ist vom Fach. Sie kann Dir fachkompetent R√ºckmeldung und Unterst√ºtzung geben.

Ber√ºhrungs- und Kontaktpunkte. Du hast regelm√§√üig Kontakt zu Kunden sowie zu Kolleginnen und Kollegen aus anderen Bereichen. Die Kollegen aus dem Bereich Softwareentwicklung unterst√ºtzen Dich gerne beim Entwickeln und Anbinden notwendiger Schnittstellen.

Reiset√§tigkeit. Du kannst viele Aufgaben virtuell machen. Du arbeitest rund 1 Tag/ Monat vor Ort bei Kunden.

_

Das bringst Du mit

Fachlich/ methodisch. Erfahrung als IT-Berater/ Dienstleister f√ºr externe Kunden, idealerweise externe Kunden in den Funktionen GF, Controlling/ kaufm√§nnische Bereiche. Erfahrung im Bereich Automatisierung, Analyse und Visualisierung von Gesch√§ftsdaten. Erfahrung mit einem Tool zur Gesch√§ftsanalyse und zur Darstellung von Gesch√§ftsdaten aus verschiedenen Datenquellen, z.B. MS Power BI, Grafana, Qlik, Tableau. Erfahrung mit Datenbanksystemen, z.B. MySQL, MS SQL.

Qualifikation. Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Betriebswirtschaftslehre oder vergleichbare Qualifikation. Quereinsteiger, Fachfremde und Autodidakten mit entsprechender Berufserfahrung willkommen.

Pers√∂nlich/ sozial. Hohes Ma√ü an Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Selbstst√§ndigkeit. Interdisziplin√§res und agiles Mindset. Einsatzbereitschaft und Teamf√§higkeit.

Deutschkenntnisse. C2 oder muttersprachliches Niveau in Wort und Schrift.

_

Das bieten wir Dir

Wir m√∂chten Dir gerne ein individuelles Angebot machen. Dies k√∂nnen wir erst, wenn wir Dich kennengelernt haben. Bis dahin teilen wir gerne unsere Angebots-Standards mit Dir.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
As a Senior Data Analyst at Blacklane, you will be at the forefront of our data-driven initiatives, transforming complex datasets into actionable insights that drive business decisions. Your role will involve developing dashboards, reports, and visualizations, collaborating with cross-functional teams to understand and meet their data needs, and conducting advanced statistical analyses. You will ensure data integrity and accuracy, communicate findings effectively, and contribute to the strategic direction of our data division within the engineering department. This position offers opportunities for continuous learning, flexible working arrangements, and participation in a diverse, inclusive environment.




YOUR CHALLENGE:

Analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to track key metrics.
Own part of our data transformation layer where we apply data modeling techniques (via dbt) to transform raw data into analytics-friendly data assets
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements.
Conduct advanced statistical analyses and predictive modeling to support strategic decision-making.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy through rigorous validation and quality checks.
Develop domain expertise in a set of business domains (e.g. Product, Marketing, Operations or Sales) to become a valuable partner to our business stakeholders
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at all levels.

ABOUT YOU:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
4+ years of experience in data analysis or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Experience in data modeling using DBT
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Experience with statistical analysis and predictive modeling is a plus.







About Blacklane

Our mission is simple but powerful: to become the world‚Äôs leading premium, global chauffeur service. Operating in 50+ countries, we reimagine chauffeur-driven rides by prioritizing reliability, innovation, and first-class service at every step. Blacklane is also at the forefront of sustainable mobility efforts, continuously working to reduce our operational impact on the planet.




Our Company Culture

Blacklane has grown from a two-person startup in Berlin to a global team of over 300 people representing 54+ nationalities. Powered by our commitment to care, inclusion, innovation, and collaboration, we support employees through initiatives like Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), mentorship programs, and more.




Here are just a few examples of the ERGs fostering connection:

LGBTQIA+ Network ‚Äì Advocating for inclusivity and championing allyship.
Bookclub ‚Äì Encouraging cultural exchange, fostering discussion, critical thinking, and team engagement through shared reading and analysis.
Blacklane Cares Leave ‚Äì Spend up to eight paid hours annually volunteering for causes meaningful to you.

We welcome‚Äîand actively support‚Äîemployees to create or join the communities that are important to them.




Why join us in a Blacklane on the fast lane?

Fair Pay & Shared Success ‚Üí We provide good salaries and automatically enroll all employees in our Virtual Stock Options Plan (VSOP). Your shares vest over four years, with full transparency on their value growth through Ledgy.
Blacklane Mystery Rides ‚Üí As a valued contributor to our success and growth, we are pleased to offer you one complimentary ride per quarter to experience and evaluate our chauffeur services firsthand.
Learning & Development at Blacklane ‚Üí We value the person beyond the CV, which is why we are committed to your continuous growth‚Äînot just for the company‚Äôs success, but for your own professional development. We believe that when our employees stay ahead, so does Blacklane. That‚Äôs why you have free access to thousands of online courses on LinkedIn Learning, tailored to your career aspirations, along with a unique learning experience designed for those stepping into leadership roles.
The way to your heart goes through your stomach? ‚Üí If so, we‚Äôve got something special for you, in Berlin: our weekly homecooked, quality office lunches. Not only do they fuel your mind and body, but they also provide the perfect opportunity to connect with colleagues from all departments, fostering stronger bonds beyond your own division.
Your Health, No Compromise ‚Üí with Nilo Health & WHOOP
We prioritize both your mental and physical well-being because a healthy team creates a thriving culture. That‚Äôs why we offer access to the Nilo Health platform for mental wellness and the WHOOP bracelet, after one year to support your fitness‚Äîavailable for you to use as you choose.
Social responsibility ‚Üí We Care: Learn more about Miracle flights and the meaningful impact behind our commitment to making a difference.
Share your ideas with Blacklane‚Äôs C-Level ‚Üí Our approachable C-Level team values your insights. Once a month, they host a consultation day where you‚Äôre invited to share your ideas, feedback, and constructive criticism‚Äîbecause your voice shapes our future.
Thrive Together ‚Üí Our Hybrid Office Culture: At Blacklane, we believe in the power of in-person collaboration and connection. That‚Äôs why we follow a hybrid, 3 office day focused approach. This supports both our fast-paced growth and the building of strong, engaged teams. We know everyone‚Äôs situation is unique, so our hybrid setup still allows for flexibility when needed. If you‚Äôre excited about contributing in a dynamic, people-driven environment and value both teamwork and personal accountability, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!




Do you have any questions or want to know more about our way of working? Feel free to contact us. We‚Äôre happy to connect!

We place great value on equal opportunities. Therefore, we welcome everyone to apply!




Curious to see us in action? Let‚Äôs go!

‚Üí Watch us on Amazon Prime‚Üí Listen to our CEO in Startup insider episode #1643

‚Üí Blacklane is backed by investors who share our vision: Mercedes-Benz Mobility, Tasaru, Sixt, the Al Fahim Group, Alstin Capital, RI Digital Ventures, and b2venture

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Company: For Life Produktions- und Vertriebsgesellschaft f√ºr Heil- und Hilfsmittel mbH
Description:
We are FORLIFE! We are passionate about developing, manufacturing, and distributing stoma, incontinence, and wound care products, as well as supportive products for enteral nutrition. Our ambitious goals have helped us become one of the leading suppliers of medical devices in Europe. At our modern production site in Berlin-Adlershof, over 150 employees work to identify and meet the needs of patients and healthcare professionals.




Your Tasks:

Direct to Consumer(DtC) project support: Contribute to the development and execution of our DtC initiative ‚Äî including setup, insights on consumer behavior, and performance tracking
CRM data cleansing & consistency: Ensure high-quality customer and device data by identifying and resolving duplicates or gaps in our CRM system
Customer segmentation & analysis: Deliver targeted segmentation and behavioral insights to support commercial, marketing, and clinical strategy
Master data quality assurance: Maintain and improve product and customer master data across internal systems, hospitals, and patient portals
Dashboard & report creation: Build intuitive dashboards (Power BI, Excel) to support decision-making with relevant KPIs, trends, and user metrics
Process improvement: Collaborate with Sales, R&D, and Support to optimize CRM workflows and ensure data governance and compliance
Go-to data resource: Serve as the central contact point for business stakeholders who need analysis, reporting, and structured data support
Support strategic and clinical initiatives: Provide data and insights for product launches, service evaluations, compliance reporting, and patient-focused initiatives




Your Profile:

2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analytics or business intelligence, ideally in healthcare, pharma, or another regulated industry
Proven ability to manage projects and drive deliverables independently across multiple functions
Strong stakeholder management skills ‚Äî able to collaborate with commercial, clinical, technical, and leadership teams
Hands-on experience with CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce, SAP, Dynamics, or similar)
Strong skills in Power BI, Excel, SQL, and Python
Experience or interest in DtC analytics, customer behavior, or e-commerce tracking
Interest in AI tools such as Microsoft Fabric ‚Äî Microsoft‚Äôs unified platform for analytics and BI
Strong analytical mindset and confident communicator
Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Biostatistics, or related field
Being Fluent in English is a must, German a plus




Our Benefits:

Meaningful work ‚Äì Your work contributes to the reliable manufacture and use of vital medical devices.
Great team: A motivated and helpful environment that supports you.
Company pension plan with a 20% employer contribution for a secure future.
Special payments in accordance with the company agreement.
Individual training opportunities to promote your professional and personal development.
Business bike leasing for environmentally friendly and healthy mobility
Regular team events to promote strong and collegial cooperation
Mobility or sports subsidy: Choice of subsidy for BVG ticket or Urban Sports Club
Show more

Title: Data specialist/Statistician ‚Äì based in Luxembourg
Description:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Secretariat General (SG) ‚Äì Economic Department (ECON) ‚Äì Economic Studies Division (ES) ‚Äì Statistical Unit (SU) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a Data specialist/Statistician*.

This is a full-time position at grade 4 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.


Internal benchmark Associate Economist


Panel interviews are foreseen as from the end of August 2025 .

Purpose

You will maintain economic databases, statistics, as well as contribute to economic and econometric analysis to derive recommendations that help shape strategic decision-making of the EIB in order to contribute to policy formulation and dialogue.

Operating Network

The unit is positioned in SG/ECON/ES but serves the needs of the whole department. The unit designs, develops and maintains all databases, manages the contractual agreements with private database providers, offers statistical and econometric support to ECON staff, maintains the ECON server and various data toolkits posted on the EIB website and organises the sharing of data through secured and restricted web access with external collaborators.

In addition, the unit contributes to automatize processes related to country, policy and research work, provides technical support related to the ratings of sovereigns and banks as well as to local currency pricing. Relatedly, it manages control functions and critical report declarations such as EUC and ICF. You will report to the Head of the Statistical Unit, under the overall supervision of the Head of the Economic Studies Division and the Director of the Department.

Accountabilities


Maintain the Department‚Äôs data-architecture, including databases, tools and interfaces.
Support and contribute to statistical, econometric and economic analyses.
Support the technical implementation of tools for surveys and data analytics based on surveys.
Communicate analytical results visually and contribute to standardizing reporting and presentation outputs in a way that can be understood by non-experts.
Contribute to the development of tools to standardize the presentation of economic output of the department.
Collaborate with the assigned IT team on the solutions of the process simplification and automation.
Liaise with relevant counterparts within the Department, the Bank as well as in other national, EU, and international institutions and think tanks.
Contribute through database development and relevant analysis to the policy dialogue and the analysis of key models and policy papers and presentations as well as for other internal and external stakeholders.
Propose improvements of processes, procedures, methodologies and working methods.


Qualifications


University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in econometrics, quantitative economics, mathematics, statistics, information technology;
At least 3 years of experience in statistical analyses, database management and econometrics, for example acquired working in the relevant units of an international or EU institution, statistical office, consulting, government, banking, academia;
Programming skills (Python, R, SQL, VBA, MiKTeX, JavaScript) and knowledge of relevant software for data management and analysis (Stata, RStudio, SAS);
Knowledge of applied quantitative methods;
Knowledge of economic concepts and standard relevant macroeconomic and microeconomic data series and sources
Previous experience in integrating big data in economic analysis and/or knowledge of survey statistical methods would be an advantage;
Experience in written, visual and oral communication of complex quantitative analyses;
Ability to deliver under time pressure when needed;
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French and a good knowledge of the other (**). Working knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(**) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

This is an open campaign to consecutively fill an open position. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.


Show more
HTML:
This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Secretariat General (SG) ‚Äì Economic Department (ECON) ‚Äì Economic Studies Division (ES) ‚Äì Statistical Unit (SU) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a Data specialist/Statistician*.

This is a full-time position at grade 4 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.

  • Internal benchmark Associate Economist

Panel interviews are foreseen as from the end of August 2025 .

Purpose

You will maintain economic databases, statistics, as well as contribute to economic and econometric analysis to derive recommendations that help shape strategic decision-making of the EIB in order to contribute to policy formulation and dialogue.

Operating Network

The unit is positioned in SG/ECON/ES but serves the needs of the whole department. The unit designs, develops and maintains all databases, manages the contractual agreements with private database providers, offers statistical and econometric support to ECON staff, maintains the ECON server and various data toolkits posted on the EIB website and organises the sharing of data through secured and restricted web access with external collaborators.

In addition, the unit contributes to automatize processes related to country, policy and research work, provides technical support related to the ratings of sovereigns and banks as well as to local currency pricing. Relatedly, it manages control functions and critical report declarations such as EUC and ICF. You will report to the Head of the Statistical Unit, under the overall supervision of the Head of the Economic Studies Division and the Director of the Department.

Accountabilities

  • Maintain the Department‚Äôs data-architecture, including databases, tools and interfaces.
  • Support and contribute to statistical, econometric and economic analyses.
  • Support the technical implementation of tools for surveys and data analytics based on surveys.
  • Communicate analytical results visually and contribute to standardizing reporting and presentation outputs in a way that can be understood by non-experts.
  • Contribute to the development of tools to standardize the presentation of economic output of the department.
  • Collaborate with the assigned IT team on the solutions of the process simplification and automation.
  • Liaise with relevant counterparts within the Department, the Bank as well as in other national, EU, and international institutions and think tanks.
  • Contribute through database development and relevant analysis to the policy dialogue and the analysis of key models and policy papers and presentations as well as for other internal and external stakeholders.
  • Propose improvements of processes, procedures, methodologies and working methods.

Qualifications

  • University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in econometrics, quantitative economics, mathematics, statistics, information technology;
  • At least 3 years of experience in statistical analyses, database management and econometrics, for example acquired working in the relevant units of an international or EU institution, statistical office, consulting, government, banking, academia;
  • Programming skills (Python, R, SQL, VBA, MiKTeX, JavaScript) and knowledge of relevant software for data management and analysis (Stata, RStudio, SAS);
  • Knowledge of applied quantitative methods;
  • Knowledge of economic concepts and standard relevant macroeconomic and microeconomic data series and sources
  • Previous experience in integrating big data in economic analysis and/or knowledge of survey statistical methods would be an advantage;
  • Experience in written, visual and oral communication of complex quantitative analyses;
  • Ability to deliver under time pressure when needed;
  • Excellent knowledge of English and/or French and a good knowledge of the other (**). Working knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.

Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here

(**) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.

We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

This is an open campaign to consecutively fill an open position. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

Title: Staff Product Analyst - Consumer Product
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Consumer Product Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

The Consumer Product Analytics Team drives product strategy and innovation by providing actionable insights on customers and products, contributing to business success. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to shape the experience for millions of users across our worldwide portfolio of platforms (FoodPanda, Pedidos Ya, Woowa, Yemeksepeti, Foodora, Talabat, HungerStation, eFood, and Glovo), directly impacting customer satisfaction and driving growth. Our diverse team of data professionals is based in Berlin, working closely with product directors, product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to directly influence product direction. We collaborate with a larger data team, including data engineers, data scientists, and ML engineers, to share knowledge and expertise.

At Consumer Product Analytics, you will have the opportunity to access high volume, rich user behavior data, engage in end to end product development cycles, work on complex product problems, and learn from many experienced data professionals.

The main responsibilities of the Product Analytics Team include:


Strategic Impact & Product Leadership: Act as a key strategic data partner to product leadership, influencing product roadmap and investment decisions through deep analytical insights and foresight. Proactively identify high-impact analytical opportunities to drive significant customer satisfaction and business growth.
Advanced Experimentation & Causal Inference: Design, implement, and rigorously analyze A/B tests and other experimental designs (e.g., multi-variate, quasi-experiments) with a strong emphasis on advanced statistical methods for robust hypothesis validation, accurate impact measurement, and understanding causal relationships. Drive the standardization and continuous improvement of our experimentation framework across multiple brands.
Metric Framework & OKR Ownership: Define, establish, and own comprehensive product metric frameworks and quarterly OKRs. Drive alignment on "what good looks like" across product teams, ensuring clear, measurable goals that align with strategic business outcomes.
Data Integrity & Tracking Excellence: Take ownership of tracking definition and work closely with various Delivery Hero brands to significantly improve the reliability, consistency, and completeness of user behavior tracking for our discovery tools. Proactively identify and resolve data quality issues at scale.
Scalable ETL & Reporting Solutions: Design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines and self-service dashboards, ensuring data accessibility and empowering product teams to make data-driven decisions independently.
Deep Dive & Exploratory Analysis: Conduct complex, end-to-end exploratory analyses on large-scale user behavior data (transactional, clickstream, etc.) to uncover non-obvious insights, identify root causes of trends, and directly inform product strategy and roadmap development.
Technical & Mentorship Leadership: Contribute significantly to the growth and development of fellow product analysts through knowledge sharing sessions, best practice dissemination, workflow optimizations, and active participation in hiring and onboarding processes. Champion and drive analytical excellence within the team and broader organization.


Qualifications


9+ years of experience in product analytics or a related data-focused role, preferably within rapidly growing and dynamic environments, and with a broad mission scope or multiple stakeholders.
Experience working in Search & Recommendations systems.
Expert proficiency in SQL and Python for complex data manipulation, analysis, and modeling. Experience with BigQuery and large-scale cloud data warehousing concepts is a strong plus.
Expertise in statistical methods applied to experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate tests, etc.), causal inference, and robust hypothesis validation. You should be able to navigate complex statistical challenges and explain methodologies clearly.
Extensive experience working with large-scale user behavior data (e.g., transactional, clickstream, app usage), including data cleaning, transformation, and analysis to derive actionable insights.
Proficiency with at least one data visualization tool such as Looker Studio (Data Studio), Tableau, QlikView, or Power BI, with a proven ability to create compelling and insightful dashboards.
Demonstrated ability to influence and collaborate with multiple stakeholders, including senior product managers, engineers, and business leaders. You can clearly communicate complex analytical findings and successfully drive large-scale analytics projects end-to-end (e.g., defining success metrics for a tribe, standardizing measurement across brands, or implementing new experimentation methodologies).
Experience with customer behavior tracking platforms (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, MixPanel, Snowplow, Segment, Tealium).


Nice to have:


Experience with Airflow, DBT, or other data pipelining tools
Familiarity with recommender systems, ML models, or ranking algorithms
Experience scaling analytics processes or experimentation programs across multiple teams or brands.


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: IIoT Business Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
You want to redefine how entire industries work by leveraging IoT, Smart Manufacturing and Industry 4.0?

Would you like to be part of the success of a digital solution which will revolutionize the manufacturing process to improve shop floor performance? If your answer is a big yes, you should continue reading!

With HQ in Berlin, FactoryPal is a corporate Start-Up ‚Äì with an additional location in Porto/Portugal. The venture is poised to become the leading end-to-end IoT solution for machine efficiency and equipment effectiveness. The digitally enabled solution is not just completely reshaping how companies produce and elevate their efficiency levels, but it is fundamentally augmenting the way manufacturing employees do their job.

We are data scientists, engineers, designers, IIoT experts, product managers, and manufacturing operations consultants. We are a team, united by our shared ambition: revolutionize manufacturing and transform the way it is done to ensure smooth operations.

Become part of an amazing journey and successfully accompany our customers in their Digital Factory efforts!

Your Role & Key Responsibilities as a IIoT & Business Data Analyst

Data Transformation And Analysis

Joining our customer value analytics team as a data analyst means you'll be an essential part of further developing FactoryPal's analytics product as well as supporting value creation within our customer projects. Together with our experienced data analysts, you'll work on the following topics:


Generate key insights into customer data by extracting, cleaning, and transforming data from our Snowflake data warehouse using dbt.
Create and maintain data pipelines to ensure accurate and timely data delivery.
Explore large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies to tell stories with data.


Business Intelligence (BI) Reporting


Work with Tableau to create insightful reports and interactive dashboards to be embedded in the FactoryPal application.
Visualize complex data in a user-friendly manner, enabling stakeholders to make informed decisions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand reporting requirements and deliver actionable insights.


Stakeholder Management & Product Development


Understand and identify the analysis and reporting needs of key customer contacts and internal stakeholders
Derive and communicate insights into customers‚Äô machine and business data.
Contribute with your experience to our product development process and thereby enhance FactoryPal‚Äôs analytics solution.


Your Experience & Skills


Master‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Industrial Engineering, STEM or related fields)
5+ years of experience in data analysis, modeling and reporting in a relevant environment - ideally in the industrial / manufacturing sector
Strong analytical mindset and a passion for working with data
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases
Profound experience in data modeling ideally with dbt
Experience with Business Intelligence Tools (ideally Tableau)
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git)
Solid knowledge of Python for data analytics
Experience maintaining and troubleshooting Airflow DAGs is a plus
Ideally first experience in development of an analytics product using agile methods
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively within our team
Willingness to take ownership of tasks and seek solutions independently
Your English is fluent


What You Get


Opportunity to work in a well-funded corporate Start-Up with a competitive advantage derived from market access.
Exposure to the hottest IT technologies, like AI/ML, Cloud and Industrial IoT
Challenging role with lots of opportunities to grow fast & steadily - as an expert and as an entrepreneur
Development opportunity in a group of professionals, who joined from top tier start-up, industry and consulting companies and an education from top tier universities
Our amazing Berlin office in the AI Campus with access to Berlin‚Äôs AI ecosystem
An agile, inspiring, multi-cultural, multi-disciplinary and innovative work environment with great colleagues
A competitive salary & benefits package and dedicated training budget


Are you interested?

Join our team and send us your detailed application documents via the "Apply" button.

Title: Data Analyst, Client Onboarding
Description:
Work Location: Berlin or Amsterdam

Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Be


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges
Set up long-term dashboarding and tracking to monitor key metrics
Conduct A/B tests to evaluate and optimize business decisions
Perform deep-dives into socio-economic factors and distribution channels to uncover actionable insights


What We're Looking For


Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
Solid statistical & technical foundation (e.g., A/B Testing, hypothesis testing) with a self-driven and proactive attitude
Strong verbal and written communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Knowledge of financial markets & financial products (options, futures, etc.)


What We Offer


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience
Free lunch from our cook, fresh juices & fruit
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 per year
Trips & activities with your colleagues
Relaxed and informal working environment
Discount for membership of the Urban Sports Club
Additional contribution to the company pension scheme
In-house German and English courses with a native speaker and cover half of the costs


About Us

LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The Best Choice For Anyone Who Takes Investing Seriously

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

We're an equal-opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified and eligible candidates without attention to gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.

HTML:
Work Location: Berlin or Amsterdam

Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Be

  • Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
  • Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges
  • Set up long-term dashboarding and tracking to monitor key metrics
  • Conduct A/B tests to evaluate and optimize business decisions
  • Perform deep-dives into socio-economic factors and distribution channels to uncover actionable insights

What We're Looking For

  • Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
  • Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
  • Solid statistical & technical foundation (e.g., A/B Testing, hypothesis testing) with a self-driven and proactive attitude
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)
  • Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
  • Knowledge of financial markets & financial products (options, futures, etc.)

What We Offer

  • Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience
  • Free lunch from our cook, fresh juices & fruit
  • Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 per year
  • Trips & activities with your colleagues
  • Relaxed and informal working environment
  • Discount for membership of the Urban Sports Club
  • Additional contribution to the company pension scheme
  • In-house German and English courses with a native speaker and cover half of the costs

About Us

LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The Best Choice For Anyone Who Takes Investing Seriously

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

We're an equal-opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified and eligible candidates without attention to gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
The role

We are seeking a driven and ambitious Data Analyst to join our growing Data Analytics team, based in Berlin. Our team provides support across all teams like Product, Sales and Operations by developing insights and enabling analytical and automated decision making. We build strong partnerships with key stakeholders and work on challenges such as defining, implementing and tracking company-wide metrics, and leading initiatives to improve them.




Zenjob is on the mission to become the digital staffing platform delivering companies best staffing experience with the highest flexibility and reliability, and workers the best choice and fair pay for side jobs. Our service is available in over 39 cities in Germany. Our growth financing round of $50 million (‚Ç¨45 million) from February 2022 is helping us to scale our platform and add new data-based automation features for our rapidly growing customer base.




What you‚Äôll be doing:

Requirements gathering

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and define data analytical requirements that will help driving business initiatives
Define KPIs, success and health metrics in the context of product and business initiatives

Data collection and preparation:

Identify relevant data sources and work with data engineers and tracking experts to source the right data into the analytics environment
Prepare data to make it suitable for the analysis in context

Data exploration and analysis:

Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and insights
Utilize statistical methods to extract actionable information from data
Develop and maintain core data models to support business analysts

Experimentation

Support stakeholders during the hypothesis formulation and validation phase
With the collaboration of the data science and engineering teams, design and implement experiments around upcoming product features

Visualization and reporting

Design and create effective data visualizations to communicate insights and trends
Hands-on experience with traditional BI tools (Tableau, Metabase) and, ideally, product analytics tools (Indicative) as well

Communication and collaboration

Communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and nontechnical audiences
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business analysts, data engineers, and product managers and decision makers
Provide training and support to end users for interpreting and using data visualizations in a self-service manner effectively




What you‚Äôll bring

5-+ years of relevant experience interpreting data as an analyst or equivalent
High proficiency in querying and modeling data using Python and SQL
Ability to translate a business question into an analytical requirement considering its context: what the business is trying to achieve, the processes around it, the systems that interact and the data points available
Analyze the results of A/B-test experiments and derive conclusions or new hypothesis the business can follow up on
Great communication skills in stakeholder management from diverse backgrounds
Great communication skills in storytelling capable of creating a consistent narrative that gives meaning to the numbers
Extensive experience using different data visualization and reporting tools
Experience on analytics engineering using dbt is highly desirable
Plus: experience with experimentation platforms (eg. ABSmartly, Optimizely) and product analytical tools (eg. Indicative, Amplitude)




What we offer:

A supportive, open, and fun team that will have your back from day 1.
Twenty-eight days of vacation (increases based on tenure to up to 30 days), 1-day special leave paid for charity work, five days of paid educational leave, and the option of unpaid leave.
Hybrid work setup combining office & remote work (3 days from office, 2 days home), flexible working hours, bring your dog policy.
Ongoing focus on your personal development (annual development budget of EUR 750, mentoring opportunities, continuous career conversations)
Mental Health support via Likeminded
Monthly 30 EUR subsidy on Urban Sports Club, 25% discount on FitX gym membership
Monthly 40 EUR credit for NAVIT- a sustainable mobility solution spanning public transport bike-sharing.
Tax-free meal allowance (saving EUR ~50 net per month!)
Quarterly team get togethers, budget for employees birthdays, winter & summer parties plus regular cultural talks & events




If this sounds exciting to you, then we'd love to find out more about you! Apply and send in your application.




Life at Zenjob revolves around innovation, collaboration, and growth. Check out our video for a glimpse into what it's like to be part of our team: Link to Video üé•

We invite you to explore our Career Page, follow our LinkedIn page, and connect with us on Instagram.




We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to assessing every qualified person according to their skills, regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status or religion. It is not necessary to include your photo and age with your application.
