Title: Staff Product Analyst - (Logistics)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst - (Logistics) to join our Analytics team and shape the future of data strategy, experimentation, and impact at Delivery Hero.

In Logistics, we build products and shape processes towards an amazing delivery experience for our customers, riders, and service. In the Analytics team, we curate data to uncover insights, enable self-service discovery, and drive the strategic development of Logistics functions. Being embedded in the Product Line, we foster the ‚Äúdata-first‚Äù mindset and drive change in product development.

As a Staff Product Analyst, you‚Äôll work across multiple squads, domains, and functions within a tribe to drive end-to-end analytics excellence. You‚Äôll partner with stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Data to build impactful solutions, mentor colleagues, and help define the strategic direction of analytics across the organization. You will not only bring deep technical and business expertise to your tribe, but also champion innovation, collaboration, and quality at scale.

This is your opportunity to join a passionate, high-impact team and influence how we use data to make decisions that shape the future of local delivery.

Your mission:


Own problem-solving and solution design for highly complex business and technical challenges, balancing speed and quality.
Align product analytics lifecycle practices with business goals ‚Äì from scoping and data tracking design to data curation, analysis, visualization, and stakeholder alignment.
Lead experimentation strategy and execution across squads, guiding engineering and data science partners on implementation, tracking, and interpretation.
Define and maintain domain- and tribe-level metrics and KPIs, and ensure adoption of scalable, insightful dashboards.
Drive forward scalable analytics infrastructure, build technical capabilities, and set standards for data quality and insight generation.
Provide guidance and mentorship to other analysts, fostering a culture of knowledge-sharing and technical excellence.


Qualifications


6+ years of experience as a Product Analyst, Data Analyst, Data Scientist or similar role, preferably in fast-paced tech or internet companies.
Proven ability to lead technically complex and high-impact projects with autonomy.
Expert SQL skills and practical experience with large-scale data platforms (e.g., BigQuery).
Solid Python skills (for analytics and automation use cases).
Experience in applied statistics and designing and guiding complex A/B testing strategies
Proven track record in building scalable, user-centric dashboards and reporting tools (Tableau or similar).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities; capable of translating business goals into analytics roadmaps.
Deep understanding of product development and business strategy, with experience aligning analytics to strategic outcomes.
Demonstrated mentorship and leadership capabilities within data/analytics functions.
Self-directed, highly versatile, and solution-oriented mindset.


Nice to have:


Experience with Airflow or similar orchestration tools.
Familiarity with Git and version control for analytics workflows.
Experience contributing to analytics infrastructure and self-service tooling.
Thought leadership in the field of analytics (e.g., talks, papers, forums).


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Analyst, Client Experience
Description:
Work Location: Berlin or Amsterdam

Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Be


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges
Set up long-term dashboarding and tracking to monitor key metrics


What We're Looking For


Solid analytical skills in structured and unstructured data (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
A self-driven and proactive attitude
Strong verbal and written communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Knowledge of financial markets & financial products (options, futures, etc.)


What We Offer


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience
Free lunch from our cook, fresh juices & fruit
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 per year
Trips & activities with your colleagues
Relaxed and informal working environment
Discount for membership of the Urban Sports Club
Additional contribution to the company pension scheme
In-house German and English courses with a native speaker and cover half of the costs


About Us

LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The Best Choice For Anyone Who Takes Investing Seriously

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

We're an equal-opportunity employer. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified and eligible candidates without attention to gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
Show more

Title: AI Data Annotators - Zaza (hiring globally)
Description:
We are looking for AI Data Annotators with native or near-native speaker fluency in Zaza, and English skills to understand written instructions.


Job Type: Freelance
Start Date: Immediately
Duration: Short-term. You will be added to our database for suitable opportunities!
Schedule: Flexible, work at your own availability
Rate: 15 USD/hour




Help Shape the Future of AI
Are you a native (or near-native) speaker of Zaza and some English skills looking for a flexible freelance role? Join this exciting project and help improve AI language identification models for one of the biggest AI -oriented companies worldwide!

What You‚Äôll Do
In this project, you will perform language and dialect identification tasks, reviewing responses from two different models and deciding which one identified a proposed language correctly. You‚Äôll select answers from predefined options such as ‚Äúnone,‚Äù ‚Äúfirst model,‚Äù ‚Äúsecond model,‚Äù ‚Äúboth,‚Äù or ‚Äúreject.‚Äù

Your input will play a vital role in training safer and more accurate AI systems!

Responsibilities


Annotate and evaluate :200 samples in Zaza
Select the correct model outputs from predefined options
Ensure accurate language/dialect identification and consistent annotations




Requirements


Native (or near-native) fluency in Zaza
Advanced English skills (to understand instructions)
Linguistic studies or equivalent background
Reliable internet connection and personal computer
Ability to follow detailed annotation guidelines
Comfortable working with potentially sensitive or objectionable content




Benefits


100% remote work
Flexible freelance schedule
Competitive hourly rate: 15 USD/hour
Be added to our global AI talent pool and considered for future projects




RWS embraces DEI and promotes equal opportunity, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind. RWS is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at RWS are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, religion, nationality, ethnicity, sex, age, disability, or sexual orientation. RWS will not tolerate discrimination based on any of these characteristics.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (Intern)
Description:
Your mission

As a Junior Data Scientist during our 6 month internship, you‚Äôll be an active member of our data science team, responsible for designing, building, and deploying components of our data and machine learning stack. The position will be on-site in our Berlin office. Example projects include:


Designing and maintaining ETL pipelines to process supplier and customer data from Excel, PDF, ERP, and unstructured sources.
Building data wrangling, cleaning, and validation pipelines to ensure high-quality, reliable datasets for downstream models.
Contributing to recommendation systems based on live inventory, purchase behavior, and customer preferences.
Using Prefect, Airflow and MLflow to manage workflows, track experiments, and deploy models.
Evaluating model performance and proposing improvements.
Supporting the creation of dashboards and KPIs to monitor algorithm performance and business impact.
Collaborating with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to align technical solutions with real customer needs.


Your profile

We‚Äôre looking for someone who is junior but job-ready - able to contribute independently while still growing their skills. You should have:


~1 year of practical experience in data science, machine learning, or data engineering (internship, research, or industry).
Strong skills in Python (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Experience with SQL and working with structured data.
Knowledge of ETL pipeline design and data wrangling.
Familiarity with MLOps tools such as Airflow or MLflow.
Solid understanding of machine learning fundamentals (training, validation, evaluation, deployment).
An advanced degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or another quantitative discipline.
The ability to communicate clearly, explain your approach, and work well with both technical and non-technical team members.


NICE TO HAVE


Experience with graph databases (e.g., Neo4j) and writing Cypher queries.
Exposure to large language models (LLMs) and their ecosystem (prompt engineering, RAG, CrewAI, Agno, LangChain, or LangGraph).
Hands-on experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Familiarity with deploying models on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure).


Why us?


Ownership of projects with a focus on outcomes rather than time-tracking
Fast-paced yet collaborative culture fostering individual performance and teamwork
Competitive compensation based on experience
Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
Subsidized Deutschlandticket
Hybrid work format
Beautiful office located in the heart of Prenzlauer Berg, Berlin
Regular team building events, company breakfasts and Friday drinks


About Us

We are a Berlin-based start-up that has successfully established a leading B2B marketplace for industrial metals across Europe.

The multi-billion-euro metal trading industry is operated on Excel, PDF and Email. We are on a mission to transform buying and selling in one of the oldest industries of the modern world with seamless and intuitive digital solutions. Our technologies increase liquidity, accelerate transactions, reduce scrapping rates and enhance buying convenience for hundreds of steel and metal distributors across Europe.

We are a lean team of young, international, and passionate talents gearing up for the next phase of growth. We are looking for an outstanding individual who wants to join an exciting early stage start-up.
Show more

We are a lean team of young, international, and passionate talents gearing up for the next phase of growth. We are looking for an outstanding individual who wants to join an exciting early stage start-up.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Size & Fit (all genders) AS
Description:
At Zalando, we believe that an article that doesn‚Äôt fit well is the wrong article for our customers. As a Senior Data Analyst in the Size & Fit team, you will play a key role in addressing the challenge of finding the right fit in online shopping. Our mission involves gaining a deep understanding of customers‚Äô preferences related to size and fit, as well as a comprehensive knowledge of the assortment attributes and measurements from our brands. The real magic happens when we successfully match both.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with the Applied Science team and act as a bridge to Product, Business, and Engineering. You will measure and analyze how the solutions we provide to our customers are impacting our business, and your insights will enable strategic commercial decisions at Zalando. Would you like to bring in your skills to shape a great experience for millions of customers when buying clothes online?

About Size & Fit

At Zalando, we deeply understand that Size Matters . We are excited to use our unique and large article and customer datasets to tackle this challenge using ML and Computer Vision techniques.

You will join our multidisciplinary Zurich & Berlin-based Size and Fit Team, composed of Machine Learning Researchers, Software Engineers, Designers, Product and Business Managers from 30+ different nationalities. We provide advice on customer size and fit choices and conduct focused experiments using emerging technologies to solve the challenges.

You will take on this complex and important topic working side by side with our Product Specialists and Applied Scientists. We have great problems to solve, a huge customer base to impact, and we are a team that loves to have fun. 'Size and Fit' is a human topic. We use machines to help solve our customers‚Äô challenges. But we never forget‚Äîsize and fit success is defined by how customers feel when they wear fashion.


WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)




Bring your business data-driven analytical approach to the Size & Fit Team; you generate hypotheses and try to test them by performing descriptive, exploratory, and quantitative analyses. You can translate metrics from algorithmic and data products into actionable business insights. You know when a hypothesis can only be tested by an experiment, and you can help create and drive them.
You are the connector between the Applied Science team and the Product team. You can translate the Size and Fit benefits to answer complex business questions and identify and measure commercial opportunities.
Be a reliable partner for the Size & Fit Team when related to commercial reporting and analytics, and support the Team with more complex analysis.
Avoid working in silos by collaborating with cross-functional leaders from Applied Science, Product, Content and Customer Analytics to drive innovation. You incorporate data from different sources within and outside of Zalando to drive projects.




WE‚ÄôD LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




You have a proven track record of 5+ experience as a Data Analyst or similar role. A university degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Quantitative social science, or a comparable subject.
Strong technical background with advanced SQL skills and programming background, including, but not limited to, Python and Spark. Excellent knowledge in coding for data retrieval, exploration and analysis. Advanced statistical testing skills. Constant drive and tenacity to learn new techniques and tools are a must.
Understanding of the economics of online platforms and/or online fashion retailers, as well as the commercial KPIs governing their success.
Strong communication to convince technical and non-technical audiences with the insights you generate and compelling data-driven storytelling that enables decision-making.
Enjoy working cross-functionally; you have great stakeholder management skills to work with different levels of management to support, challenge, and bring solutions.
Hands-on mentality, a person who always finds solutions to challenges. You are proactive, can adapt quickly to changes, and always remain focused on our quality objectives.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Supply Analytics
Description:
Change the way the world travels

Be part of the GetYourGuide journey and connect people with unforgettable travel experiences worldwide. Since 2009, millions of travelers have booked unique activities with us in over 12,000 cities. Our headquarters in Berlin is supported by 16 other local offices across the globe.

Ready to join a diverse community of over 850 fellow explorers dedicated to revolutionizing the travel experience industry? Check out our careers site to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

Your mission


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams‚Äô strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Your toolkit


6+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


What Sets You Apart


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


We want your journey with us to be extraordinary

Here‚Äôs how you can expect us to commit to you and your growth.


Annual personal growth budget and mentorship programs for continuous learning and development
Work from anywhere in the world for 40 days per year
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Opportunities to collaborate and socialize with team members through quarterly team events and yearly company-wide events
Monthly transportation and fitness budget
Discounts for you, your friends, and family on GetYourGuide activities
Language reimbursement program
Health and wellness benefits


And more‚Ä¶

How To Apply

Submit your CV/resume in English using the form below. For tips and insights into our hiring process and culture, check out ‚Äòhow we hire‚Äô and ‚Äòlife at GetYourGuide‚Äô. If you have any further questions, please don‚Äôt hesitate to get in touch at jobs@getyourguide.com.

We‚Äôre an equal opportunities employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with your application.


Show more

Title: (Junior) Business Intelligence & Data Science Analyst (m/w/d) Flug
Description:
√úber diesen Job

CHECK24 ist das Vergleichsportal: Wir sind Marktf√ºhrer und dynamisches Startup in einem. Mit unserem Flug-Vergleich helfen wir t√§glich tausenden Kunden, den perfekten Flug einfach, transparent und g√ºnstig zu finden.

Speed, Excellence in Execution und absolute Kundenorientierung - das ist unsere DNA und die leben wir Tag f√ºr Tag. In agilen Teams treffen wir dabei schnelle Entscheidungen, leben flache Hierarchien und setzen auf modernste Tools, Technologien und Methoden aus Business Intelligence & Data Science, um Innovationen voranzutreiben ‚Äì immer mit Blick auf den Mehrwert f√ºr unsere Kunden.

Zur Verst√§rkung unseres Teams suchen wir Dich als (Junior) Business Intelligence & Data Science Analyst (m/w/d) bei der CHECK24 Vergleichsportal Flug GmbH. Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

Was Du mitbringst


Ausbildung: Sehr gut abgeschlossenes Studium mit mathematischem Hintergrund (z.B. Wirtschaftsmathematik oder Statistik)
Praktische Erfahrung: Erste Erfahrung in Data Analytics, Business Intelligence und Tracking w√ºnschenswert; Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Datenbanken (SQL) sowie idealerweise erste Programmierkenntnisse (z.B. Python, R)
Tools: Fundierte Erfahrung mit Tableau (Desktop, Prep Builder, Server); Erfahrung im Bereich Web Analytics, idealerweise mit Google Analytics
Arbeitsweise: Freude am analytischen, strukturierten und ergebnisorientierten Arbeiten, kombiniert mit einem hohen Qualit√§tsbewusstsein
Mindset: Hands-on-Mentalit√§t, Eigeninitiative und Teamgeist

Title: Product Analyst - (Logistics Customer, Seamless)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for an experienced Product Analyst to join the Customer Product Line, Logistics Analytics Team, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In Logistics, we build products and shape processes towards an amazing delivery experience for our customers, riders, and service. The role is for Seamless domain in the Customer Product Line. In the Seamless Analytics team, we curate data to uncover insights, work closely with the product, enable self-service discovery, and drive the strategic development of Logistics functions. Being embedded in the Product Line, we foster the ‚Äúdata-first‚Äù mindset and drive change in product development.

As a Product Analyst, you will bring insights for one or more domains, collaborate with a team of about 5-7 analysts, drive projects across various data functions, collaborate with Data Science and Backend Engineers and enable our stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Operations to make data-driven decisions.


Engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights
Build accessible, creative and engaging data visualizations to facilitate access to insights
Develop and curate unstructured data in collaboration with Data Engineering, Product and Operations
Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and generate new data analyses
Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives
Own our data catalog for all Logistics dimensions, metrics and KPIs
Be an active player in working with and understanding the product end to end, its features and gaps and provide useful and necessary insights to the team to improve the product always
Ensuring proper AB testing for the features that we launch, sharing insights from the significance tests


In our Logistics Team, you‚Äôll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

Qualifications


2-4 years experience as a BI/Data/Product analyst working for internet companies
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
Excellent SQL skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)
Intermediate Python skills, with practical experience
You are creative in data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus)
Experience with version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
Proven team player behavior and process-oriented mindset
Independent and rigorous working style, appreciation for Agile environments
Good English communication skills
Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects
Proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes
Highly passionate about data, with creative problem-solving abilities and an eye for detail
Nice to have: Experience with orchestration tools such as airflow, DBT, metaflow


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Senior Product Analyst - (Quick Commerce)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Data Analytics team within Quick Commerce, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Be part of redefining how customers experience quick commerce. You‚Äôll help build technology that scales our non-food offerings, reaching new market segments and driving revenue growth. By innovating within our Quick Commerce Team, you‚Äôll make Delivery Hero the go-to platform for a broad range of products, helping us grow faster and deliver more value to customers around the world.

You will partner closely with Product Managers, driving operational excellence and strategic insights across Fulfillment Operations, Supply Chain and Demand Planning. Focusing on metrics monitoring, deep dive analysis, experimentation, and fostering a data-driven culture. Your insights will directly shape product roadmaps, optimize features, and assess impact. You will define KPIs, design experiments, and communicate findings to senior stakeholders. You'll help us ensure product initiatives deliver measurable business value, transitioning from a reporting mindset to a problem-solving approach. Your work will directly impact our ability to scale and grow our non-food offerings.

Key Responsibilities:


Collaborate with Product Managers and cross-functional teams to define hypotheses, KPIs, and success criteria
Conduct in-depth analyses of product usage, adoption, and impact metrics to identify trends and opportunities
Design and execute experiments(A/B, Quasi-experiment) to optimize product features and user experience
Establish effective causal inference strategies to evaluate interrelations and identify growth drivers
Support the implementation of tracking strategies and ensure data integrity
Generate business intelligence solutions and compelling visualizations to communicate key insights


Qualifications


Proven 3-5 years experience in Product Analytics or Data Analytics, ideally within a fast-paced product-driven environment
Excellent stakeholder management, communication and collaboration skills
Strong technical expertise in analytics stack including SQL, dbt, Airflow, and Python, with proficiency in visualization tools (Tableau, Looker Studio) and experience with A/B testing platforms (Optimizely, Adobe Target)
Solid understanding of statistical concepts, experimental design, A/B testing methodologies and Quasi Experimentation
Experience with event tracking and instrumentation tools
Ability to work autonomously and navigate through uncertainty


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team?

If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate, and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

HTML:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Data Analytics team within Quick Commerce, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Be part of redefining how customers experience quick commerce. You‚Äôll help build technology that scales our non-food offerings, reaching new market segments and driving revenue growth. By innovating within our Quick Commerce Team, you‚Äôll make Delivery Hero the go-to platform for a broad range of products, helping us grow faster and deliver more value to customers around the world.

You will partner closely with Product Managers, driving operational excellence and strategic insights across Fulfillment Operations, Supply Chain and Demand Planning. Focusing on metrics monitoring, deep dive analysis, experimentation, and fostering a data-driven culture. Your insights will directly shape product roadmaps, optimize features, and assess impact. You will define KPIs, design experiments, and communicate findings to senior stakeholders. You'll help us ensure product initiatives deliver measurable business value, transitioning from a reporting mindset to a problem-solving approach. Your work will directly impact our ability to scale and grow our non-food offerings.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with Product Managers and cross-functional teams to define hypotheses, KPIs, and success criteria
  • Conduct in-depth analyses of product usage, adoption, and impact metrics to identify trends and opportunities
  • Design and execute experiments(A/B, Quasi-experiment) to optimize product features and user experience
  • Establish effective causal inference strategies to evaluate interrelations and identify growth drivers
  • Support the implementation of tracking strategies and ensure data integrity
  • Generate business intelligence solutions and compelling visualizations to communicate key insights

Qualifications

  • Proven 3-5 years experience in Product Analytics or Data Analytics, ideally within a fast-paced product-driven environment
  • Excellent stakeholder management, communication and collaboration skills
  • Strong technical expertise in analytics stack including SQL, dbt, Airflow, and Python, with proficiency in visualization tools (Tableau, Looker Studio) and experience with A/B testing platforms (Optimizely, Adobe Target)
  • Solid understanding of statistical concepts, experimental design, A/B testing methodologies and Quasi Experimentation
  • Experience with event tracking and instrumentation tools
  • Ability to work autonomously and navigate through uncertainty

Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service

  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Ready to join our team?

If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate, and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Title: Senior Data Analyst - Data Platforms (m/f/d)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Analyst to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?

Flatiron Health is a healthtech company using data for good to power smarter care for every person with cancer, around the world. Flatiron partners with cancer centers in the US, Europe and Asia to transform patients‚Äô real-life experiences into real-world evidence and create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. Our multidisciplinary teams include oncologists, data scientists, software engineers, epidemiologists, product experts and more. Flatiron Health is an independent affiliate of the Roche Group.

What You'll Do

The Senior Data Analyst position is a position within our broader International Data Science organization. The Data Science team is a diverse and talented group of individuals with strong expertise in discovering and understanding customer needs, making data-driven decisions within an ambiguous problem space, and rapidly prototyping and iterating on data products.

Building on 10 years of experience in the US, Flatiron‚Äôs international team is scaling Flatiron‚Äôs approach in new countries. Streamlined teams in each market are establishing partnerships with local cancer providers, and developing high-quality real-world data for researchers around the world. Data Scientists and Data Analysts are embedded on those teams and their work touches every aspect of Flatiron‚Äôs international product and strategy. This position specifically will be embedded on one of our Data Platforms teams which is focussed on developing tooling for curating unstructured data.

Specifically, you‚Äôll:



Collaborate with cross-functional partners to track metrics and support decision-making for clinical data processing operations
Build dashboards for internal use cases; support users by conducting ad-hoc analyses and taking action on user feedback.
Conduct analyses to provide insight into user behavior for our internal tools to help inform product decisions.
Immerse yourself in business and technical context to help your team identify opportunities for optimizing our processes and unlocking new value from our unique datasets.



Who You Are

You're a kind, collaborative and analytic problem solver and value the opportunity to think beyond the way things are. In addition,



You have 3+ years of industry experience in relevant roles or have completed a PhD in a relevant field.
You‚Äôre impact-oriented, and care deeply about creating real change for customers, users, and ultimately patients. You choose the right, rather than the flashiest, method available to reach your goals.
You have a strong background in analytics and can fit the appropriate analysis approach to complex business or research problems.
You are a clear and confident communicator who can explain technical concepts to business and clinical partners.
You are versatile and can easily pick up new programming languages and tools, but come with strong experience in Python.
You have a record of success driving initiatives forward by generating buy-in, managing complexity, and continuously delivering business impact.
You are proficient in English.



Optional



You have experience working with healthcare-related data.



Who We Are

Our people are at the center of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity. Visit the Life at Flatiron page to learn more.
Show more

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
TripleTen is a service that empowers individuals, regardless of their prior experience, to embark on the exciting and challenging journey of mastering tech professions such as software engineering, data science, business intelligence analytics, and QA in a feasible and accessible way, ultimately leading to employment opportunities.*

Our mission is to ensure that every student has the opportunity to successfully master a new profession and become a valuable member of the tech industry. We are successfully producing highly desirable tech professionals in the most competitive EdTech market in the world - the US market.

What you will do:


Conduct exploratory analyses to uncover actionable product insights and opportunities from our existing data
Independently lead full-cycle analytical projects ‚Äî from scoping problems from stakeholders requirements to initiating data collection (if needed) with data engineers and developers, and delivering actionable outcomes:
Tableau dashboards
In-depth product research reports
Evaluation of changes from the experiment (without A/B testing)
Foster a data-driven culture by training and advising product teams on data-informed decisions, experiments set up, designing metrics (product, learning, KPIs)


Requirements:


3+ years experience in the role of data/product analyst.
Ability to choose an appropriate statistical test and conduct statistical research
Experience independently analyzing data and generating hypotheses/insights using industry-standard analytics tools (i.e. SQL, Python)
Strong data communication and interpretation skills including designing dashboards (i.e. Tableau) and presenting complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Upper-intermediate (B2+) English level.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience doing analytics on educational products
Experience with PySpark and/or Tableau


What we can offer you:


Fully remote and full-time collaboration with professional freedom and minimal micromanagement;
Dynamic Team: Join a diverse, global team with experience across tech, ed-tech, and various industries;
We use digital tools like Miro, Notion, and Google Workspace for seamless collaboration;
Impactful Work: Your efforts directly influence the success rates of students finding jobs post-graduation.
At this time, we are unable to offer H-1B, L-1A/B sponsorship opportunities.
This job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required. Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time.


Ôªø


TripleTen is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, protected military/veteran status, or any other legally protected factor.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics | Assisted relocation to Barcelona
Description:
Who we are:

Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.




We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet‚Äîand at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.




Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We‚Äôve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington‚Äôs Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.




At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones‚Äîand we wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we‚Äôre committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people‚Äîand that starts with our employees.




Who we're looking for:




The Marketing Analytics team supports the company‚Äôs marketing efforts, while also working with teams throughout the organization. The analytics team is responsible for a number of business-critical reports and data models that our global marketing teams rely on for daily reporting, budgeting, and analysis. We measure marketing attribution to understand how people become Rover customers, provide campaign reporting to monitor trends in cost efficiency and optimization, deliver lifecycle data to action against a variety of customer behaviors, and narrate the business to identify and prioritize new opportunities.




We are specifically looking for an analyst to act as a trusted thought partner to marketing stakeholders with a focus on overhauling data infrastructure, driving measurable outcomes, optimizing our brand content strategy, and scaling cross-sell programs across our many customer engagement channels. They will have experience operating autonomously to deliver on complex, cross-functional initiatives.




*This is a hybrid position that has the minimum expectation to work out of our Barcelona Office in the Poblenou neighborhood two days per week on Mondays and Thursdays. For this reason, candidates must be based in Barcelona or willing to relocate.

Your Responsibilities:

Build the lifecycle data infrastructure from the ground up ‚Äì defining our measurement strategy (A/B tests, rotating holdouts, etc.), building conversion-based datasets for near-real-time customer interactions, and facilitating an expansion into push notifications and paid reactivation campaigns
Partner with our global brand team to optimize our brand content across multiple channels, including email, blog, and organic channels.
Own the cross-sell analytical functions for our email and blog programs, growing the reach of our brand voice to new target audiences.
Influence the global strategy of your partner teams by crafting and refining key performance indicators that measure the health of our business




Your Qualifications:

At least 4 years experience working cross-functionally with complex datasets to support organizational decision making.
Fluency in SQL. You would feel confident reviewing code produced by other analysts and data scientists, as well as assisting non-technical colleagues with their reports in an office hours setting.
Hands-on experience running A/B tests as well as expertise in statistical analysis
Familiarity with programming in Python or R.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Specifically, you know how to narrate models and results to business partners in a useful, concise, and meaningful way.
Experience working with cross-functional business partners to define business problems, scope project deliverables/timelines, implement reporting solutions, and frame organizational strategy.
You prioritize your work on impact to the business and can gracefully push back on stakeholders




Nice to Have:

Two-sided marketplace and/or marketing analytics experience
Understanding of digital touchpoints and measurement mechanisms
Marketing analytics with a focus on customer lifecycle marketing
Meaningful experience processing large data sets at scale. This could include languages like Python or R, as well as frameworks like Spark, Hive, or dbt.
Experience with AWS (Redshift, S3, EMR)
Understanding of modeling techniques, such as linear regressions, causal impact models, and bootstrapping. You know the trade-offs of each of these models and can propose the right model for the test at hand




Benefits of working at Rover:

Competitive compensation
Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
Permanent contract
Pension plan
Meal tickets through Cobee
Generous PTO allowance
Private health insurance
Discounted gym membership
Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
Monetary help for adopting a dog or cat plus yearly credit to use on our platform
A wide variety of snacks, fresh fruit, and beverages in our kitchen to keep yourself going
Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more




Locations:

This position is located at our Barcelona office
We assist with relocation to Barcelona




Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We‚Äôre driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

  • We assist with relocation to Barcelona


Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/x) Product Analytics
Description:
Job Description

We at sevDesk:

We at sevDesk don't have a universal formula for happiness in the world of work either, but we work together every day to understand exactly what can permanently increase our sevFamily's sense of happiness. One thing is for sure: with us, you can be exactly who you are and work in a way that suits you and your needs! It's not the work that defines us, it's us that define the work!

Our culture is not artificial, it is real. Be yourself at sevDesk - BE YOURSEV!

Your mission:

You are an analytical consultant for the data- and insights-driven development of our product portfolio. With your analyses, you identify growth potential and influence our product roadmap with your recommendations for action.

Here's how you'll make an impact:


You drive analytics initiatives that inform product strategy, user growth, and engagement optimization, ensuring alignment between data outputs and business priorities.
You translate data into clear, impactful insights for product and marketing teams to guide feature development and customer experience improvements.
You‚ÄØdevelop actionable insights through powerful visualizations, cohort analysis, etc. supporting experimentation, lifecycle management, and personalization efforts.
You lead and own the implementation of data collection and product experimentation, establishing rigorous methodologies and clear metrics frameworks.
You mentor peer analysts and stakeholders in best practices for data interpretation, dashboarding, and storytelling, driving a data-first product culture.


Your Qualification:


You have at least 5 years of experience in the digital environment. You have already worked as a Data Analyst (m/f/x) for at least 3 years and have mentored other analysts.
You have a degree in (business) informatics, economics, (business) mathematics,‚ÄØcomputer science, or comparable.
You have at least 2 years of application experience in SQL and a good technical understanding of common data modelling techniques such as Kimball‚Äôs Dimensional Modelling and/or OBT.
You have experience in the use of business intelligence tools (e.g. Looker, Power BI, Tableau) and analytics tools (e.g. Mixpanel, Amplitude, Google Analytics).
You have relevant experience in the conception and evaluation of A/B tests, a functional knowledge of statistical testing‚ÄØtechniques is a plus.


Our Techstack: SQL | Snowflake | dbt | Python | Looker | Metabase | Mixpanel

Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a stock option plan and company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you‚Äôre most productive, whether that‚Äôs at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: learning budget, bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, ‚Ä¶), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!

For more insights, visit us on Instagram



Contact:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Marc Riehle
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

We at sevDesk:

We at sevDesk don't have a universal formula for happiness in the world of work either, but we work together every day to understand exactly what can permanently increase our sevFamily's sense of happiness. One thing is for sure: with us, you can be exactly who you are and work in a way that suits you and your needs! It's not the work that defines us, it's us that define the work!

Our culture is not artificial, it is real. Be yourself at sevDesk - BE YOURSEV!

Your mission:

You are an analytical consultant for the data- and insights-driven development of our product portfolio. With your analyses, you identify growth potential and influence our product roadmap with your recommendations for action.

Here's how you'll make an impact:

  • You drive analytics initiatives that inform product strategy, user growth, and engagement optimization, ensuring alignment between data outputs and business priorities.
  • You translate data into clear, impactful insights for product and marketing teams to guide feature development and customer experience improvements.
  • You‚ÄØdevelop actionable insights through powerful visualizations, cohort analysis, etc. supporting experimentation, lifecycle management, and personalization efforts.
  • You lead and own the implementation of data collection and product experimentation, establishing rigorous methodologies and clear metrics frameworks.
  • You mentor peer analysts and stakeholders in best practices for data interpretation, dashboarding, and storytelling, driving a data-first product culture.

Your Qualification:

  • You have at least 5 years of experience in the digital environment. You have already worked as a Data Analyst (m/f/x) for at least 3 years and have mentored other analysts.
  • You have a degree in (business) informatics, economics, (business) mathematics,‚ÄØcomputer science, or comparable.
  • You have at least 2 years of application experience in SQL and a good technical understanding of common data modelling techniques such as Kimball‚Äôs Dimensional Modelling and/or OBT.
  • You have experience in the use of business intelligence tools (e.g. Looker, Power BI, Tableau) and analytics tools (e.g. Mixpanel, Amplitude, Google Analytics).
  • You have relevant experience in the conception and evaluation of A/B tests, a functional knowledge of statistical testing‚ÄØtechniques is a plus.

Our Techstack: SQL | Snowflake | dbt | Python | Looker | Metabase | Mixpanel

Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a stock option plan and company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you‚Äôre most productive, whether that‚Äôs at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: learning budget, bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, ‚Ä¶), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!

For more insights, visit us on Instagram



Contact:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Marc Riehle

Title: Junior Database Engineer Intern
Description:
Company Overview

Join our team as a Junior Database Engineer Intern and gain hands-on experience with modern database design, PostgreSQL administration, and enterprise data synchronization. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to learn professional database management while working on a real-world recruitment platform integration.

Position Summary

As a Junior Database Engineer Intern, you will assist in maintaining and improving our Manatal database synchronization system. You'll work closely with senior engineers to learn best practices in database design, performance optimization, and professional documentation.

Learning Opportunities & Responsibilities


Assist in monitoring database performance and creating performance reports
Learn PostgreSQL database administration and optimization techniques
Help document database schemas and relationships using professional ERD tools
Support data validation and quality assurance processes
Participate in troubleshooting data inconsistencies
Assist in writing SQL queries for reporting and analysis
Learn Docker basics and container management
Contribute to technical documentation and data dictionaries
Explore modern database platforms like Supabase
Participate in database design reviews and team meetings



Required Basic Skills


Educational Background:
Currently pursuing or recently completed degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
Strong academic performance in database or data structures courses

Technical Foundation:
Understanding of relational database concepts and SQL basics
Familiarity with at least one programming language (Python, JavaScript, or similar)
Basic understanding of data structures and algorithms
Comfortable with command-line interfaces
Strong analytical mindset

Soft Skills:
Excellent attention to detail
Strong problem-solving abilities
Good written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently and in a team
Eagerness to learn new technologies



Good to Have Skills


Previous internship or project experience with databases
Familiarity with PostgreSQL or other SQL databases
Experience with any ERD or database design tools
Basic knowledge of Docker or containerization
Understanding of JSON data format
Exposure to Linux/Unix environments
GitHub experience for version control
Familiarity with modern database platforms (Supabase, PlanetScale, etc.)
Basic understanding of API concepts



What You'll Learn


Enterprise-level database design and optimization
Professional ERD tools and documentation standards
PostgreSQL advanced features and performance tuning
Modern database platforms and cloud services
Docker and containerization for databases
Real-world data synchronization challenges
Professional development practices



Internship Details


Duration: 6 months (with possibility of extension or full-time conversion)
Flexible hours (minimum 20 hours/week)
Remote work available
Mentorship from senior database engineers
Hands-on experience with production systems
Certificate of completion and recommendation letter for successful interns

Title: Associate Consultant
Description:
Role Description

This is a full-time on-site role for an Associate Consultant at CloudDev Solutions Studio located in Berlin, Germany. The Associate Consultant will be responsible for providing expert advice and strategic guidance to clients, conducting thorough business analysis, developing tailored solutions, and ensuring the successful implementation of projects. The role involves collaborating with cross-functional teams, managing project timelines, and delivering high-quality consulting services to meet client needs.




Qualifications

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience in business analysis and requirement gathering
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Project management abilities and attention to detail
Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment
Proficiency in relevant software tools and technologies
Bachelor's degree in Business, Management, Information Technology, or related field
Prior experience in consulting or client-facing roles is a plus

Title: Data & AI Consultant (m/f/d)
Description:
Brief description

Dataciders, a dynamically growing group of companies in the upper midmarket, is a leading service provider in the IT service environment with a focus on data and AI in German-speaking countries. Our success is confirmed by our 1st place in the renowned L√ºnendonk list for data & analytics services.

We are characterized by our flexibility and enthusiasm for technological trends and innovations. We live change and shape the future.

At ixto, you will work in an interdisciplinary team from IT, economics, data science and other exciting disciplines - united by a passion for turning ideas into real solutions. You will not only be given room for your expertise, but also the freedom to actively shape our projects, processes and culture. Innovation is not a department for us - it is our everyday life.

What you can expect in your new job


Projects in state-of-the-art data & AI technologies
Challenges along the entire data value chain: from the cloud platform to the data loading route to the BI report and ML model
Varied activities between customer workshops and coding sessions
Exciting customers in the DACH region from a wide range of industries


Your profile


You have a high ability to learn and enthusiasm for current developments in the field of data & AI
You are self-confident and customer-oriented - both in workshops and in long-term customer projects
You have experience with current AI/ML technologies such as OpenAI's GPT models, Microsoft Azure AI Foundry or Databricks Mosaic AI
You have experience in current data technologies such as Microsoft Fabric or Databricks
You are proficient in Python; we would like to see knowledge of other programming languages (e.g. Java, C#, TypeScript)
Ideally, you have experience with cloud platforms such as Microsoft Azure, AWS and GCP
You are characterized by strong communication skills, ability to work in a team and willingness to travel
You are proficient in German (C1) and English (C1)


What we offer you

We are a leading provider of customized data solutions that form the basis for important decisions for our customers. Join us in designing projects that work!


A well-coordinated team of inquisitive talents and experienced consultants
A working environment that promotes personal responsibility, trust and real participation
Personal development with learning time budgets and knowledge transfer within the team
Regular team and sports events - from online lunches to annual retreats
Projects with real added value: our solutions create transparency and decision-making security for our customers
flexible working hours
Further training
modern hardware
Extensive sports & wellness flat rate via leading company fitness providers
Support for your mental fitness via OpenUp, a strong offer for mental health and resilience promotion
Fruit and drinks in the office


We are looking forward to your application!

Have we piqued your interest? Then apply now!

Take your chance and send your complete application with CV, cover letter and references, stating your salary expectations and availability, as a PDF document.

You are also welcome to send an e-mail to: jobs@dataciders.com

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Company: For Life Produktions- und Vertriebsgesellschaft f√ºr Heil- und Hilfsmittel mbH
Description:
We are FORLIFE! We are passionate about developing, manufacturing, and distributing stoma, incontinence, and wound care products, as well as supportive products for enteral nutrition. Our ambitious goals have helped us become one of the leading suppliers of medical devices in Europe. At our modern production site in Berlin-Adlershof, over 150 employees work to identify and meet the needs of patients and healthcare professionals.




Your Tasks:

Direct to Consumer(DtC) project support: Contribute to the development and execution of our DtC initiative ‚Äî including setup, insights on consumer behavior, and performance tracking
CRM data cleansing & consistency: Ensure high-quality customer and device data by identifying and resolving duplicates or gaps in our CRM system
Customer segmentation & analysis: Deliver targeted segmentation and behavioral insights to support commercial, marketing, and clinical strategy
Master data quality assurance: Maintain and improve product and customer master data across internal systems, hospitals, and patient portals
Dashboard & report creation: Build intuitive dashboards (Power BI, Excel) to support decision-making with relevant KPIs, trends, and user metrics
Process improvement: Collaborate with Sales, R&D, and Support to optimize CRM workflows and ensure data governance and compliance
Go-to data resource: Serve as the central contact point for business stakeholders who need analysis, reporting, and structured data support
Support strategic and clinical initiatives: Provide data and insights for product launches, service evaluations, compliance reporting, and patient-focused initiatives




Your Profile:

2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analytics or business intelligence, ideally in healthcare, pharma, or another regulated industry
Proven ability to manage projects and drive deliverables independently across multiple functions
Strong stakeholder management skills ‚Äî able to collaborate with commercial, clinical, technical, and leadership teams
Hands-on experience with CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce, SAP, Dynamics, or similar)
Strong skills in Power BI, Excel, SQL, and Python
Experience or interest in DtC analytics, customer behavior, or e-commerce tracking
Interest in AI tools such as Microsoft Fabric ‚Äî Microsoft‚Äôs unified platform for analytics and BI
Strong analytical mindset and confident communicator
Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Biostatistics, or related field
Being Fluent in English is a must, German a plus




Our Benefits:

Meaningful work ‚Äì Your work contributes to the reliable manufacture and use of vital medical devices.
Great team: A motivated and helpful environment that supports you.
Company pension plan with a 20% employer contribution for a secure future.
Special payments in accordance with the company agreement.
Individual training opportunities to promote your professional and personal development.
Business bike leasing for environmentally friendly and healthy mobility
Regular team events to promote strong and collegial cooperation
Mobility or sports subsidy: Choice of subsidy for BVG ticket or Urban Sports Club

  • Individual training opportunities to promote your professional and personal development.
  • Business bike leasing for environmentally friendly and healthy mobility
  • Regular team events to promote strong and collegial cooperation
  • Mobility or sports subsidy: Choice of subsidy for BVG ticket or Urban Sports Club

Title: Data Engineer (all genders)
Description:
We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our Data and Analytics Engineering team in Berlin!

Babbel's Data and Analytics Engineering (DAE) team is dedicated to empowering data-driven decision-making across the organization. We design, build, and maintain the data infrastructure and pipelines that enable high-quality analytics, reporting, and advanced data applications.

You will:




Design, build, and optimize scalable data pipelines and integrations using Databricks (Python), dbt, and related tools.
Develop and maintain analytics workflows and dashboards in Tableau and Databricks Notebooks.
Support the migration and management of data across platforms, including Snowflake and Databricks, with a focus on reliability and scalability.
Integrate data from a variety of sources, leveraging tools like Fivetran for seamless data movement.
Collaborate with analytics, product, and engineering teams to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
Maintain and improve AWS-based data infrastructure, ensuring security, governance, and cost-effectiveness.
Participate in projects that may involve machine learning engineering and MLOps practices, supporting the development and deployment of intelligent data solutions.
Contribute to a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement within the team.


You have:


Practical experience with Databricks (Python), Snowflake, dbt, and AWS.
Familiarity with the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform, including its tools for unified analytics, data management, and AI/ML workflows and ETL/ELT best practices.
Experience with data pipeline orchestration and integration tools (e.g., Fivetran).
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and PySpark is required.
Understanding of data governance, security, and compliance in cloud environments.
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
Bonus: Experience or interest in MLOps, machine learning engineering, or supporting ML-driven applications.


Nice to Have:


Experience with orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow).
Hands-on experience with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), including preparing data for RAG, building RAG architectures, working with embeddings, vectors, and vector databases (such as those used for semantic search or LLM context retrieval)
Exposure to additional business intelligence or reporting tools.
Passion for fostering a data-driven culture and collaborating across teams.


Please note that our company's operating language is English, so you will need to be able to work in English.

Some perks of becoming a Babbelonian:


Enjoy 30 vacation days. Plus family and life situation counseling.
Set up the right schedule for you with flexible working hours and enjoy Jobbatical (up to 3 months working inside the EU and the UK), plus work from our fully equipped office with nap, faith and family rooms.
Learn and grow with the internal learning opportunities, and use a yearly learning & development budget for external training. Learn languages with Babbel for free with your full access to Babbel.
Take advantage of your mobility benefits options and a discounted Urban Sports Club membership.
Be part of our DE&I Community Networks (such as FLINTA in Tech, and Queer Collective), attend cultural and regular social events.


Diversity at Babbel

As part of our ongoing journey towards building a diverse, equitable and inclusive company, we welcome everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in tech. We are a learning company, inside and out, and we encourage you to apply even if you do not fit all the technical requirements - all candidates are assessed based on skills, qualifications and on our business needs. Please state your pronouns in your application, and let us know if you'd like to be addressed by a name other than the one appearing on your official documents. If you have a disability or special need, feel welcome to inform us, so that we can provide you with the proper assistance in the application process.
