    • Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Customer Insights (Journeys) Functional Consultant Associate (MB-220)
    • Microsoft Certified: Customer Data Platform Specialty (MB-260)
To remain competitive, support our high-performance culture and allow for more flexibility in the way we work, we offer a hybrid work model and flexible dress code for our eligible office-based workforce in Canada, the U.S. and Mexico.

About Our Business

TC Energy is a leading energy infrastructure company in North America. We have complementary businesses of natural gas pipelines and power generation. Our operations span three countries, seven Canadian provinces, and 34 U.S. states.

TC Energy is an equal opportunity employer.

Learn more

Visit us at TCEnergy.com and connect with us on our social media channels for our latest news, employee stories, community activities, and other updates.

Thank you for choosing TC Energy in your career search.

  • Depending on qualifications, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or ladder.
  • Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no restrictions.
  • All positions require background screening. Some require criminal and/or credit checks to comply with regulations.
  • TC Energy is committed to provide employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@tcenergy.com.

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
Our client is a top financial institution with significant North American holdings.¬†They have operations across most major verticals, including institutional & corporate, wealth management, private client, commercial banking, treasury, and retail banking.


Introduction: Robertson is seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our client.
¬†

Contract Period: 12 months with potential to extend
Pay Rate: Starting from $27 per hour
Location: Canada
Location Type: Fully Remote (Canada-based candidates - must be okay working EST)

Work Hours: Part-time hours. EST Flex Hours between 7am-6pm. 20 hours per week




Job Responsibilities:¬†
Communicate with internal and external customers to understand data requirements
Prioritize reporting needs of customers
Fulfill data needs of customers by report creation and escalation where necessary
Expand technical and Group Benefit knowledge to expand the subset of reports they can create
Work with Business Analytics and Advice teammates to improve report creation processes
Be a first line of defense in supporting Group Benefits data governance

Experience & Qualification Requirements:¬†¬†
0 to 2 years experience (Open to new grads and to post-secondary students looking for part-time role)
Experience in Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Experience with Power BI
Excellent communication skills ‚Äì both verbal and written
Attention to accuracy and detail is critical
Excellent prioritization skills
Strong team player with a high commitment to quality work and service

Working experience in change management and deployment cycle

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us




Aquanow is a trading and technology company powering the next generation of financial services. We‚Äôre at the forefront of the rapidly evolving digital asset space, empowering businesses to navigate the complexities of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technologies. As a leading provider of infrastructure solutions, we offer innovative services in cryptocurrency trading, liquidity management, and secure digital asset storage. Our platform is built to deliver seamless, scalable, and reliable solutions that cater to the needs of institutional clients and businesses seeking to unlock the potential of digital finance. Aquanow is committed to driving growth and shaping the future of the digital economy by offering unparalleled opportunities for innovation and advancement in the world of digital assets.




With rapid global expansion, we have established offices in Vancouver, Toronto, Dubai, Malaysia, Turkey, and beyond. Our international customer base includes some of the world‚Äôs fastest-growing fintech companies and leading financial institutions.




Your Contribution to Our Growth




We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to join Aquanow‚Äôs growing team and help shape the future of data at a leading digital asset infrastructure company. In this high-impact role, you‚Äôll be the go-to person for analytics across the business‚Äîmining transaction data, building dashboards, and supporting key reporting needs for teams like compliance, finance, and product. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with our Senior Backend Engineer to turn ad hoc insights into automated, scalable reports that power decision-making across the company.




As the first and only Data Analyst on the team, you‚Äôll have a unique opportunity to build the foundations of our data analytics function and directly influence how we leverage data to drive growth, optimize operations, and enhance the client experience. If you‚Äôre analytical, resourceful, and excited to be hands-on in a fast-paced fintech environment, we‚Äôd love to meet you!




This is a full-time, permanent position, hybrid out of our Downtown Toronto office in the financial district.




What You‚Äôll Do




Analyze and interpret complex transaction datasets related to cryptocurrency trading, payments, and B2B2C retail brokerage operations to generate actionable insights that support strategic initiatives.
Design, develop, and maintain analytics dashboards for stakeholders and clients, delivering real-time data visualizations and business intelligence reports.
Perform ad hoc data analysis, reporting, and data mining to support business inquiries and decision-making.
Prototype and validate reports prior to productionizing backend reporting workflows.
Work closely with engineering teams to design and implement self-service analytics tools that empower business users to independently access, analyze, and visualize data, and enhance self-serve data access tools for internal users.
Monitor and ensure that client, business, and regulatory reports adhere to established quality standards and deadlines, facilitating timely delivery of critical insights.
Act as a "Product Owner" for the reporting domain: manage incoming data and reporting requests, prioritize needs, and collaborate with engineering to implement scalable, automated solutions.
Identify and analyze trends and patterns in data to inform product enhancements and develop strategies for increasing client engagement.
Present findings and actionable recommendations clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, fostering understanding and supporting data-driven decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align analytics initiatives with broader business strategies and objectives.




We‚Äôd Love to See




Bachelor's Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Finance, or a related discipline.
Demonstrated experience as a Data Analyst, preferably within the fintech industry, with a strong focus on crypto trading, payments, and brokerage services.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, and R, along with proficiency in data visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong analytical skills and problem-solving capabilities, with a proven ability to convert complex data into actionable business insights.
Experience with creating business intelligence reports and ad-hoc analyses tailored to meet diverse client and regulatory requirements.
Experience working in Agile environments.
Proven ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including product management, engineering, and support.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present technical information to a non-technical audience in a clear and concise manner.
A collaborative mindset, with demonstrated experience working alongside engineers and technical teams to develop self-serve analytics solutions.
Knowledge of cryptocurrency trading, payments, and relevant regulations is a plus.
Knowledge of data governance and best practices in data management.




These are not strict requirements to thrive in this role. We believe that people can learn and understand technologies if they are willing. We encourage you to still apply if some of the requirements are missing or lacking.




At our offices you will find a group of people that embrace diversity and value performance over pedigree. Every day we draw value from the diverse experiences of our team whose backgrounds include top financial institutions, tech companies and untraditional backgrounds. Our success comes from identifying exceptional people and providing them with the platform to reach their true potential.




Aquanow is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, qualified veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other unlawful criterion or circumstance.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

FlexPay is the first to market and global leader in failed payment recovery. Our outstanding success is built upon a solid foundation of exceptional culture, adherence to our values, and an innovative AI-driven approach to solving this trillion-dollar problem. FlexPay helps subscription businesses accelerate revenue and profit growth by recovering failed payments, which is the single largest cause of customer churn.




We‚Äôre a maturing, institution-backed Fintech SaaS, solving one of the biggest problems faced by merchants. The veteran management team of serial entrepreneurs is supported by a board filled with industry leaders. Our ambition is to redefine payments and in doing so become more than just the next great unicorn, but to become a key element of the infrastructure that makes our world‚Äôs economy hum. We‚Äôre a dynamic, welcoming company that strives to hire the best and brightest people. If you are looking for a place to invest your passion, then keep reading!




What The Role Looks Like

As a Data Analyst at FlexPay, you will play a key role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that support decision-making, improve merchant performance, and drive strategic growth across the business.




A day in the life of this position includes

Conducting deep-dive analyses into transactional and merchant performance data to identify patterns, trends and anomalies
Collecting and analyzing quantitative and qualitative data to improve internal processes and client outcomes
Creating and maintaining clear, actionable reports and data visualizations to be used internally and externally
Providing proof of value reporting to clients, showcasing performance improvements and ROI
Translating complex data sets into clear, compelling insights and recommendations




Who We‚Äôre Looking For

You are a data driven analyst with strong business acumen, exceptional attention to detail, and a passion for uncovering meaningful insights. You enjoy solving complex problems, digging into messy datasets, and transforming data into clear, impactful stories. You thrive in a remote, fast-paced environment and are excited about contributing to a growing company that values autonomy, curiosity, and strategic thinking.




What We‚Äôre Looking For

Master‚Äôs degree in science, mathematics, economics or a related field (preferred but not required)
1+ year of experience in data analysis, research, or analytics-adjacent role
Strong Excel skills including pivot tables, VLOOKUP, and ETL for data cleaning and transformation
Strong data storytelling skills with a business-focused mindset
Experience with PowerBI and SQL
Experience with transactional/payment data preferred but not required
Ability to translate business questions into analytical problems and clearly communicate results
Comfortable presenting findings to internal stakeholders and clients, speaking confidently to insights
Excellent communication and organizational skills, ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
A passion for data, data visualization, and using analytics to drive decision making
Inquisitive mindset, you ask questions, dig deep, and care about data integrity
Demonstrated ability to work with ambiguity and maintain a sense of urgency
Mindset of curiosity toward AI, a demonstrated willingness to experiment with it, and an ability to think strategically about how AI can amplify their work
Curiosity toward automation and innovation in analytics
Outside of the box thinking, someone who is not afraid to ask questions and look for new/different solutions
Experience working in a remote, geographically dispersed team
Fintech experience preferred but not required.







What We Offer

We‚Äôre a quickly growing global company committed to building a team filled with diverse cultures, viewpoints, and experiences. As they say, variety is the spice of life. No matter how large we become, we will always be connected through our shared sense of community and slightly quirky personalities.




Our vibrant culture is filled with talented, creative, deeply curious, high achievers. We believe in and invest in our people because we know they are the secret to our success. We are happy to extend the following benefits to our employees:




Unlimited paid time off
100% remote work
Flexible hours
Comprehensive health benefits package effective from day one
Support for continuous learning and development.




FlexPay is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities.

Title: Data Analyst (Tableau & Power BI)
Description:
Reporting to: AVP, Internal Audit Data Analytics

Are you passionate about using data to drive meaningful insights and transform audit practices? We‚Äôre looking for a dynamic and hands-on analytics professional to join our Global Internal Audit team. In this high-impact role, you‚Äôll lead strategic analytics initiatives, enable digital ways of working, and bring data science use cases to life across audit engagements.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Lead analytical project planning and execution for audit and advisory engagements.
Collaborate with Audit teams to define scope, objectives, and deliverables, and perform data analytics procedures to evaluate controls and business objectives.
Partner with IT and business units to understand data structures, availability, and access.
Develop and execute data access plans and facilitate stakeholder discussions.
Build deep business and systems knowledge across groups to support future analytics efforts.
Design and implement proof-of-concept solutions for audit automation, continuous auditing, and monitoring.
Apply programming, statistics, machine learning, and data visualization to uncover insights and enhance risk assurance.
Contribute to audit strategy and process improvement through technology enablement.
Develop and deliver analytics training for auditors in SQL, Python, and Tableau.
Build strong internal and external networks within the analytics community.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed

5‚Äì7 years of hands-on experience in data analytics, including SQL, Python (NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn), and visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.
Experience with AWS SageMaker and statistical techniques such as regression, clustering, and anomaly detection.
Proven ability to create impactful dashboards and presentations for senior leadership.
Strong communication skills and ability to influence across all levels of the organization.
Deep understanding of IT, data analytics, digital processes, and internal controls in a corporate environment.




Preferred Qualifications

Advanced degree in Data Science, AI, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, or related fields.
8+ years of experience in the financial industry, with 5+ years in Data Science or Machine Learning and 2+ years in NLP (experience with LLMs and generative AI is a plus).
Demonstrated experience with digital platforms and technologies including web, mobile, databases, and personalization tools.
Bonus: Experience with audit analytics tools such as Archer, Arbutus, Alteryx, or Dataiku.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
ROSEN is a global technology leader serving the oil & gas and engineering industries in over 120 countries. ROSEN Canada provides Asset Integrity Services nationwide, working collaboratively to deliver innovative solutions.




We are seeking a full-time Junior Data Analyst to join our Evaluation team in Calgary. In this role, you will analyze pipeline in-line inspection data, ensuring quality, accuracy, and efficiency using proprietary software, while meeting client reporting requirements.




Key Responsibilities

Assess, prepare, and process in-line inspection (ILI) data
Integrate and verify supplementary data
Categorize, evaluate, and size features
Apply anomaly interaction rules and conduct standard/non-standard analysis
Organize and deliver results per client specifications
Maintain skills/training and support department goals




Qualifications

1‚Äì3 years‚Äô data analysis experience
Post-secondary education or technical certification
Strong troubleshooting, computer, and communication skills
Detail-oriented, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Ability to work flexible hours; occasional travel
Must have valid Canadian work authorization and pass color vision testing




What We Offer

Competitive pay, benefits, RRSP matching, flexible hours, wellness program, professional development, and career growth opportunities.

Title: Analyst - Data & Analytics
Description:
Employment Type: Full-time Regular

City: Calgary, AB (YYC)

Posting Open Date: 08/28/2025

Posting Close Date: 09/11/2025 (Please note the posting will close at 11:59pm MST)

Why WestJet:

Every WestJet journey has the potential to enrich lives; a career with us is no exception.

WestJet arrived on the Canadian airline scene in 1996 and changed the industry for the better. We made air travel more affordable for Canadians and now we're going global.

Please note: This is a hybrid work position in Calgary, Alberta and requires in-person collaboration at the WestJet Campus (22 Aerial Place NE), a minimum of 3 days per week.

Join us, this is where your career story takes off.

Overview of role:

The Revenue Analytics team provides business intelligence analytics and reporting solutions for the Revenue Management & Pricing department within WestJet. Transforming data into meaningful information is an art form that requires the combination of technical skills and business acumen. In Revenue Analytics, we approach information from the perspective of the business user, creating and developing accurate and reliable solutions that speak to both Executive and front-line audiences. The Revenue Analytics team is rapidly evolving the intelligent landscape of WestJet ‚Äì implementing creative ideas to capture efficiencies and promote cutting edge analytics.

Reporting to the Director of Revenue Analytics, you will help build a grassroots analytics function to propel WestJet to a new level of competitiveness. You will actively participate in the conceptualization, development, integration, and troubleshooting of new and existing analyses, tools, and reports - ensuring these solutions land with both Executive audiences and front-line analysts. You are an integral part of the growth of our airline as you ensure a consistent understanding, communication of, and approach to meeting strategic goals.

Key deliverables include:


Translate Revenue Management, Pricing, and Ancillary business problems into advanced solutions by developing data models and assets, experimenting with innovative ideas, creating insight to support the strategic direction of the company
Develop and implement systems and technology to produce decision support data and tools that enable WestJetters to take strategic action in a dynamic competitive environment
Develop and maintain automated systems to perform a strategic pricing and inventory activities. Select the best methodologies to approach business problems
Improves productivity and quality by automating routine tasks. Seeks to eliminate the need for human intervention and proactively identifies opportunities for quality improvement
Contribute to system adaptation and migration strategy and perform system administration tasks (user setup, system configuration) for all business unit applications
Identifies and conducts required testing efforts for business initiatives and assists, conducts, and supports testing efforts for various stakeholder groups as appropriate
Represent the business unit on large cross-business unit projects, proactively identify potential areas of improvement, and lead plausible solutions from ideation to delivery


Experience and qualifications:


Bachelor‚Äôs Degree (Computer Science, Quantitative Economics/ Math/ Stats/ Business/ Engineering or similar)
5+ years with a minimum of 3 years in an analytical role incorporating decision making and project coordination in a fast-paced environment
In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL framework and strong proficiency in SQL is mandatory
Proficiency in one or more of the following is a bonus ‚ÄìAlteryx, Tableau, Oracle, Sabre, VBA, Python, R, SAS, ATPCO, MS SQL, Snowflake
Excellent communication and presentation skills and a unique ability to bridge the communication gap between executive and front-end users
Highly motivated, organized, and autonomous individual who can collaborate cross-functionally and lead deliverables and/or projects
At WestJet we pride ourselves on our fun and friendly customer focus
Please note: Analyst level and title will be determined by the selection team based on the evaluation process and the candidates requisite experience.


The benefits of being a WestJetter:

WestJet provides all WestJetters with a competitive total rewards package. On top of that, we offer:


A fun and friendly culture with colleagues who work together to win
Travel privileges for you and your family, effective from your start date
Savings and Benefit programs that are flexible to meet your specific needs


Think we are a fit? Apply now!

About WestJet Group Of Companies

Together with WestJet's regional airline, WestJet Encore, we offer scheduled service to more than 100 destinations in North America, Central America, the Caribbean and Europe and to more than 175 destinations in over 20 countries through our airline partnerships.

Our Safety Promise

At WestJet, the safety and security of our people and our guests is a core value and at the heart of what we do. As safety and security is a shared responsibility, it is expected that you will use safe work practices to ensure your well-being and the safety of others.

WestJet recognizes that the use of Alcohol and Drugs can adversely impact a safe work environment and the well-being of others including guests, suppliers and the public, as well as place WestJet's operations at risk. All roles that are identified as safety sensitive are required to pass a Pre-Employment Alcohol and Drug Test as per WestJet's‚ÄØAlcohol and Drug Policy.‚ÄØ

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We embrace what makes us each unique, and what makes us uniquely WestJet ‚Äì and that is our people. WestJet is committed to creating an inclusive workplace that celebrates our differences by way of diversity, equity, and inclusion. As an equal opportunity employer, we want to you bring your full self to work and feel appreciated for your contributions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This is a remote position.

Job Description: Data Analyst


Position Overview
We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for collecting, interpreting, and analyzing large datasets to identify trends, provide actionable insights, and support data-driven decision-making across the organization. This role requires strong technical expertise, critical thinking, and the ability to communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and validate data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy and reliability.


Conduct statistical analysis and interpret complex data sets to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities.


Develop dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to effectively communicate insights to stakeholders.


Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide data-driven recommendations.


Build and maintain databases, data systems, and documentation for efficient information retrieval.


Support data governance initiatives, ensuring compliance with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.


Perform ad-hoc analysis and deliver timely insights to support strategic projects and decision-making.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, or a related field (Master‚Äôs degree preferred).


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role.


Strong proficiency in SQL for querying databases.


Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.


Proficiency in statistical analysis and programming languages such as Python or R.


Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, advanced formulas, data modeling).


Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.


Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to simplify complex data for diverse audiences.


What We Offer


Opportunity to work with diverse datasets and innovative technologies.


A collaborative environment that values creativity, curiosity, and continuous learning.


Professional development opportunities and support for certifications or training.








Requirements

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Inclusion without Exception




Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an equal opportunity employer, and embraces diversity in race, nationality, ethnicity, gender, age, physical ability, neurodiversity, and sexual orientation, to create a workforce that reflects the societies we operate in. Our continued commitment to Culture and Diversity is reflected in our people‚Äôs stories across our workforce and implemented through equitable workplace policies and processes.




TCS is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world‚Äôs largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive-powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile‚Ñ¢ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS operates in 55 countries and employs over 607,000 highly skilled individuals, including more than 10,000 in Canada. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $30 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2025, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.




Job Description:




Must Have Technical/Functional Skills

Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g. Information Systems, Business Analytics, Data Science).
7+ years of experience in data analysis and/or business analysis, with a focus on data governance.
Proven experience working with senior management (executive team) and leading data governance initiatives.
Deep understanding of data governance principles, frameworks, and best practices.
Extensive experience with data quality management, data profiling, and metadata management tools.
Advanced proficiency in SQL and data analysis tools (e.g Python with Pandas, R).
Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills, with the ability to tailor communication to different audiences.
Experience with data governance tools (e.g., Collibra, Alation) is highly preferred.
Industry-recognized data governance certifications (e.g. CDMP) are a plus.

Roles & Responsibilities

"We are seeking a highly experienced and skilled individual for a Senior Data Analyst / Business Analyst role with a strong focus on data governance. This senior role requires a unique blend of advanced technical data analysis capabilities, exceptional business acumen, and strong communication skills to effectively bridge the gap between technical teams and senior business stakeholders, including the executive team. Candidate will be responsible for leading data governance initiatives, conducting complex data analysis, gathering and documentation of requirements, facilitating communication across teams, and ensuring data governance compliance."




Data Governance Leadership :
Lead and facilitate meetings with senior business stakeholders (executive team) and technical teams to define and implement data governance strategies.
Drive the development and implementation of data governance policies, standards, and procedures.
Champion data governance best practices and promote a data-driven culture within the organization.
Business Analysis :
Elicit, analyze, and document complex data governance requirements from business stakeholders at all levels, including the executive team.
Translate business needs into clear and concise technical specifications for data governance solutions.
Facilitate workshops and presentations to gather feedback, build consensus, and communicate data governance principles.
Create high-quality documentation, including meeting minutes, presentations, and reports for the executive team.
Data Analysis:
Conduct in-depth analysis of complex data to identify data quality issues, inconsistencies, and gaps.
Understanding of data quality dashboards and reports to monitor data governance metrics and provide insights to the executive team.
Perform data lineage analysis to understand data flow, dependencies, and potential impacts of data governance changes.
Develop a deep understanding of Critical Data Elements (CDEs), Metadata management, and data lineage within the Organization's data landscape.
Analyze data requirements for applications and reporting, ensuring alignment with data governance policies.
Communication and Collaboration :
Communicate effectively with technical and business stakeholders at all levels, including the executive team.
Build strong relationships with cross-functional teams, including data architects, engineers, and business users.
Present findings and recommendations to diverse audiences, tailoring communication style and content as needed.




Tata Consultancy Services Canada Inc. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resources.

Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualifications for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Tammy Boyko and Carlan Wilbon with Aplin have partnered with our client to assist with an immediate opening for a Data Analyst/Operations Analyst. If you are skilled at analyzing data and internal processes, we want to hear from you! (This role will be on-sight in Winnipeg)

Overview:
Provides advanced technical knowledge and leadership to manufacturing projects that affect organization efficiency. Applies process management and process improvement techniques to resolve production concerns. Uses problem-solving, analytical, and negotiation skills to develop innovative solutions to manufacturing problems. Gathers data, conducts analyses, and develops recommendations for implementation of new systems and processes. Facilitates work teams, provides necessary training, and leads problem resolution and process improvement.

Position responsibilities:

Management information systems and data analysis
Provides analytical support using data and key performance indicator (KPI) to effectively measure and communicate performance for management review and alignment to site priorities
Analyze information systems opportunities and provide recommendations to the function/leader
Communicate status or performance to internal and intercompany stakeholders using data
Leads meetings, summarizes minutes in Executive Summary format, and develops trackers and tools that assist the leader with action plan tracking assessing performance
Assists with the identification of risks and opportunities, development of migration plans, and tracks plan implementation
Leads the development of standard tools and processes
Previous Experience:

Data analyst, specifically those with experience using Microsoft Excel.
Spreadsheet data entry
Familiar with Excel formulas
Familiarity with formatting in Excel
Familiarity with VLOOKUP function a plus but not necessary
Access database a plus but not required
Familiarity with SAP a plus but not required

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄ Senior Data Analyst ‚Äì Wealth & Asset Management




The Opportunity

We are on a journey to become a customer-centered digital leader. We‚Äôre looking for a driven, collaborative, and motivated Senior Data Analyst who is passionate about delivering strategic priorities, enabling business value, and seeing their projects/products come to life successfully.




What you‚Äôll be doing

Lead sessions with business stakeholders to gather, validate, and document requirements.
Develop and maintain Business Requirement Documents (BRD), source-to-target mappings (STM), and other data analysis documentation.
Ensure delivery of data assets that meet business needs and align with enterprise strategy.
Conduct data analysis, profiling, and metadata collection.
Drive UAT activities with the business and secure sign-off.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to ensure alignment and successful delivery.




Must-Have Qualifications

7‚Äì10 years of Data Analyst experience, ideally in Wealth Management (Retail, Retirement, Institutional, or General Accounts).
2‚Äì3 years of GenAI experience with Azure Cloud.
Proven experience in data-centric projects: Master Data Management, Data Integration, Data Warehousing, Reporting, and Big Data analytics.
Strong SQL skills ‚Äì ability to write and optimize complex queries.
Hands-on experience delivering data documentation artifacts under tight deadlines.
Excellent communication skills ‚Äì both written and verbal ‚Äì across all levels.
Experience with major trading and performance platforms: Bloomberg Polar Lake, SimCorp Dimension, Findur, Apex, Eagle, Charles River, Sylvan, Calypso.
Experience building data infrastructure (data lakes, data warehouses).
Strong knowledge of data modeling, data profiling, and validation.
Deep understanding of integrating new data sources into enterprise data platforms.

  • Proven experience in data-centric projects: Master Data Management, Data Integration, Data Warehousing, Reporting, and Big Data analytics.
  • Strong SQL skills ‚Äì ability to write and optimize complex queries.
  • Hands-on experience delivering data documentation artifacts under tight deadlines.
  • Excellent communication skills ‚Äì both written and verbal ‚Äì across all levels.
  • Experience with major trading and performance platforms: Bloomberg Polar Lake, SimCorp Dimension, Findur, Apex, Eagle, Charles River, Sylvan, Calypso.
  • Experience building data infrastructure (data lakes, data warehouses).
  • Strong knowledge of data modeling, data profiling, and validation.
  • Deep understanding of integrating new data sources into enterprise data platforms.

Title: Data Analyst III
Description:
Our client is a top financial institution with significant North American holdings.¬†They have operations across most major verticals, including institutional & corporate, wealth management, private client, commercial banking, treasury, and retail banking.


Introduction: Robertson is seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our client.
¬†

Contract Period: 6 months with potential to extend or convert
Pay Rate:¬†Starting from $47 per hour
Location: Toronto, ON
Location Type: Hybrid; 3 days onsite, 2 days remote
Business Hours:¬†Monday to Friday; 9 AM to 5 PM


Job Responsibilities:¬†

The responsibilities are divided equally between data engineering and Power BI development:
50% Data Engineering: Utilize your skills in Python, SQL, and Spark to support various data engineering projects, ensuring robust data pipelines and efficient data processing.
50% Power BI Development: Leverage your Power BI expertise to create insightful, interactive and visually appealing dashboards, providing valuable business intelligence solutions.

Experience & Qualification Requirements:¬†¬†
5+ years proficiency in Power BI: Advanced knowledge of Power BI for creating dashboards, reports, and visualizations
2+ years experience in Data Modeling: Expertise in data modeling, including the creation and optimization of data models to enhance performance and usability
DAX (Data Analysis Expressions): Strong command of DAX for building complex calculations and aggregations
Power Query/M: 5+ years experience with Power Query for data transformation and cleaning
SQL: Ability to write complex SQL queries for data retrieval and manipulation from various databases, minimum 5 years experience
ETL Processes: Understanding of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools to integrate data from different sources
Programing language: Proficiency in some programing language like python (Understanding of data types, variables, loops, conditionals, and error handling. Familiarity with Python's standard library and commonly used modules.)
Data Warehousing: Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and practices
Project Management: Experience leading BI projects, including planning, execution, and delivery and managing/maintaining the project backlog with stakeholders

****ALL CANDIDATES MUST COMPLETE A CRIMINAL AND CREDIT CHECK AS PART OF THE APPLICATION PROCESS****
¬†
How to Apply: If you are a motivated professional looking to contribute to a leading team, please submit your resume outlining your qualifications and experience relevant to this role. Robertson & the clients we represent, value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We invite all qualified individuals to apply.

Title: GCP Data Analyst - BigQuery (Canada)
Description:
About The Role

We‚Äôre seeking a GCP Data Analyst with deep expertise in BigQuery, strong SQL and Python skills, and a sharp analytical mindset to support both data validation initiatives and ongoing analytics work. This role is ideal for someone who can navigate large datasets, build robust queries, and identify inconsistencies with precision and insight.

The analyst will work across a variety of data workflows, from validating metrics during system migrations to supporting day-to-day data analysis and reporting needs. You‚Äôll leverage advanced BigQuery features‚Äîsuch as authorized views, materialized views, UDFs, partitioning strategies, and time series analysis‚Äîto ensure data integrity and surface meaningful insights. Comfort working in Python with data frames and relevant packages is also essential, particularly for tasks involving data manipulation, anomaly detection, or prototyping workflows.

A solid understanding of data engineering fundamentals and GCP infrastructure is important, as is the ability to read and interpret code in Java or Scala when collaborating with engineering teammates. Familiarity with Airflow (Composer) will help you understand orchestration logic, though this won‚Äôt be a core responsibility. Experience with BigQuery ML, anomaly detection frameworks, or Vertex AI is a plus.

Key Responsibilities:-


Write, optimize, and execute complex SQL queries in BigQuery to validate data accuracy, identify inconsistencies, and support analytics and reporting
Analyze large datasets to assess data quality, compare trends across systems, and surface anomalies or unexpected behaviors
Utilize advanced BigQuery features such as authorized views, materialized views, UDFs, partitioned tables, and joins to support scalable, high-performance analysis
Use Python (including data frames and relevant libraries) for exploratory analysis, data manipulation, and supporting validation workflows
Support time series analysis and, where applicable, anomaly detection using SQL or Python-based approaches
Assist with load/transform validation to ensure reliability and accuracy in data pipelines
Collaborate with engineering teams to understand data pipelines, with basic ability to read and interpret Java or Scala code when needed
Perform side-by-side comparisons of data across systems to ensure consistency during and after migrations
Maintain basic familiarity with orchestration tools such as Airflow (Composer) to follow pipeline logic and collaborate effectively with engineering
Work within the GCP environment, leveraging cloud tools and services to support analysis, troubleshoot issues, and navigate cloud-based workflows
Clearly communicate analytical findings and data quality issues to cross-functional stakeholders to support decision-making



Qualifications:-


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field
5+ years of experience in data analyst or analytics engineering roles with strong BigQuery, SQL, and Python skills
5+ years of experience building and operating solutions on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Strong ability to write and optimize SQL queries to validate data, analyze trends, and detect inconsistencies
Proficient in Python, including use of data frames and common analytical libraries
Experience with advanced BigQuery features such as authorized views, materialized views, UDFs, partitions, and time series analysis
Strong analytical skills and experience validating data across systems during migrations and ongoing operations
Basic ability to read and understand Java or Scala code to support engineering collaboration
Familiarity with Airflow (Cloud Composer) to interpret and trace data pipeline workflows



Nice to have:-


Familiarity with Looker or other BI tools for metric validation and reporting support
BigQuery ML and Vertex AI
Basic familiarity with legacy systems such as Oozie or Pig for reading existing scripts



Must have's:-


Proficiency in SQL, BigQuery, and Python
Advanced SQL skills in BigQuery for complex data validation, anomaly detection, and trend analysis
Experience comparing datasets across systems
Proven ability to identify and investigate data discrepancies across platforms
Strong analytical intuition to sense-check metrics and flag issues that may not trigger formal alerts
Ability to perform side-by-side metric and trend comparisons to confirm post-migration accuracy
Skilled in root cause analysis using SQL, domain expertise, and supporting context
Effective communicator who can document findings and share insights with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Familiarity with time series analysis to detect unexpected shifts, drops, or spikes in metrics
Ability to follow structured validation processes while proactively identifying workflow improvements



Travel:-


As per business requirements



The following information is required by pay transparency legislation in the following states: CA, CO, HI, NY, and WA. This information applies only to individuals working in these states.


The anticipated starting pay range for Colorado is: $ 143,700 - $ 210,760
The anticipated starting pay range for the states of Hawaii and New York (not including NYC) is: $ 153,000 - $ 224,400
The anticipated starting pay range for California, New York City and Washington is: $ 167,400 - $ 245,520



Unless already included in the posted pay range and based on eligibility, the role may include variable compensation in the form of bonus, commissions, or other discretionary payments. These discretionary payments are based on company and/or individual performance and may change at any time. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, licenses and certifications, and specific work location. Information on benefits offered is here.

About Rackspace Technology

We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world‚Äôs leading technologies ‚Äî across applications, data and security ‚Äî to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.

More on Rackspace Technology

Though we‚Äôre all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. We welcome you to apply today and want you to know that we are committed to offering equal employment opportunity without regard to age, color, disability, gender reassignment or identity or expression, genetic information, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity status, military or veteran status, nationality, ethnic or national origin, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or any legally protected characteristic. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Determined. Imaginative. Curious. If these are some of the ways you describe yourself ‚Äî we want to learn more about you! At TC Energy, we are Energy Problem Solvers ‚Äî passionate about transitioning North America to cleaner energy while meeting the energy demands of today and tomorrow. If that sounds like a challenge you want to help tackle, we want you to join our team!

The Opportunity

TC Energy‚Äôs External Relations group in Canada is currently looking to hire a Data Analyst, which can be based in Vancouver, B.C., Calgary, A.B., or Toronto, O.N.

Reporting to the Manager, Strategy, Governance & Planning, this role will be central to enabling our team‚Äôs digital transformation to support stakeholder engagement, communications, and regulatory reporting. They will support the team‚Äôs strategic objectives by building and analyzing datasets; developing and implementing technology tools; and creating reporting products that track our performance. They will have the opportunity to design, build, and maintain a technical stack that prioritizes end-users and delivers strategic outcomes.

The ideal candidate is someone who thrives at the intersection of data, technology, and external relations. They are experts at building and analyzing stakeholder datasets; able to articulate complex reports into clear and concise metrics that drive decisions; have experience working with consultant developers; and have a passion for AI and innovative solutions.

We are looking for someone who brings not only technical expertise but also a sense of curiosity ‚Äî someone who asks the right questions, explores possibilities, and thoughtfully implements technology that fits the business context. This role will have the ability to make a real impact by transforming the ways we work as one team and ultimately support our mission of building and sustaining support for TC Energy‚Äôs projects and operations.

‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

What you‚Äôll do‚ÄØ


Design, configure, and maintain Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM solutions in partnership with consultant developers to support business processes across departments.
Build, manage, report, and illustrate datasets using Power BI or other data visualization platforms.
Bring data to life through visual tools to tell a compelling narrative that supports internal and external decisions.
Build and maintain solutions using Dataverse, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and Power Pages with the purpose of translating data into actionable insights.
Develop and maintain our Monday.com project management tool, with a focus on simplifying our use of the platform.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders across External Relations Canada and TC Energy to gather requirements, translate them into technical specifications, and deliver scalable solutions that meet our strategic objectives.
Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance across CRM and BI platforms.
Provide end-user training and support to maximize adoption and value realization.



Minimum Qualifications‚ÄØ


3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or database management, using visualization platforms tools like Power BI.
Intermediate experience with CRM systems, particularly Microsoft Dynamics 365 (Sales, Customer Insights: Journeys, or related modules).
Strong understanding of Dataverse schema design and data modeling.
Proficiency in Power Apps (Canvas and Model-Driven), Power Automate, Power BI, Power Pages, and Customer Insights ‚Äì Journeys.
Familiarity with Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) principles and hands-on experience using Azure DevOps for solution deployments.
Awareness of data governance, privacy, and compliance considerations in technology implementations.
Strong analytical, curious, and problem-solving mindset to explore, question, and thoughtfully implement technology in alignment with business processes.
Ability to write clear functional documentation and user stories.
Proven communication skills to translate data and technical concepts to into actionable insights
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Systems, Information Systems, Statistics or a related field (equivalent work experience with demonstrated expertise in Power BI, Dynamics 365 and the Power Platform will also be considered).



Preferred Qualifications‚ÄØ


Strong understanding of business processes in corporate services, operations, or energy sectors.
Basic coding skills (e.g., JavaScript, C#, Power Fx) to support more complex scenarios.
Familiarity with Microsoft 365 ecosystem and integration points.
Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., Monday.com).
Preferred certifications:
Microsoft Certified: Power BI (PL-300)
Microsoft Certified: Power Platform Functional Consultant Associate (PL-200)
Microsoft Certified: Power Platform App Maker Associate (PL-100)
Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Customer Insights (Journeys) Functional Consultant Associate (MB-220)
Microsoft Certified: Customer Data Platform Specialty (MB-260)

To remain competitive, support our high-performance culture and allow for more flexibility in the way we work, we offer a hybrid work model and flexible dress code for our eligible office-based workforce in Canada, the U.S. and Mexico.

About Our Business

TC Energy is a leading energy infrastructure company in North America. We have complementary businesses of natural gas pipelines and power generation. Our operations span three countries, seven Canadian provinces, and 34 U.S. states.

TC Energy is an equal opportunity employer.

Learn more

Visit us at TCEnergy.com and connect with us on our social media channels for our latest news, employee stories, community activities, and other updates.

Thank you for choosing TC Energy in your career search.


Depending on qualifications, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or ladder.
Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no restrictions.
All positions require background screening. Some require criminal and/or credit checks to comply with regulations.
TC Energy is committed to provide employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@tcenergy.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Driving Data Management and Reporting Excellence for our Clients and Internally

¬†

JOIN OUR INNOVATIVE & GROWING TEAM




Are you passionate about data and eager to make a strategic impact? We‚Äôre excited to create a new role for a Data Analyst who will lead the charge in setting and establishing best practices around data management, migration, and reporting‚Äîboth for our clients and our internal operations. If you‚Äôre a proactive, detail-oriented professional with a vision for data excellence, we want to hear from you.

¬†

YOUR ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES

¬†

Lead efforts to develop and implement best practices for client data management, migration, and integration processes
Design, build, and improve Power BI reports and dashboards that drive actionable insights for clients and internal stakeholders
Support data imports, data flows, and system integrations to ensure seamless data transfer and consistency
Collaborate with clients and internal teams to understand data needs, translating them into scalable, efficient solutions
Establish standards for data quality, security, and governance across projects and internal processes
Advise on data-related strategies to optimize reporting, analytics, and decision-making
Document processes, workflows, and best practices to ensure consistency and continuous improvement

¬†

WHAT YOU BRING

¬†

Proven experience with data migration, integrations, and Power BI reporting
Strong understanding of data flows, management, and best practices
Ability to lead initiatives around data quality, security, and standards
Excellent problem-solving, organization, and communication skills
Passion for creating scalable, effective data solutions that benefit clients and teams
Self-motivated, proactive, and eager to influence data practices at a broader level
Background in data science, computer science, or related fields is a plus

¬†

WHY JOIN US?




This is a key growth role that offers the opportunity to shape our data strategies, improve operational efficiencies, and deliver enhanced insights to our clients. Join us as we build a smarter, more data-driven future.




COMPANY VALUES

¬∑¬†We Understand the ‚ÄòWhy‚Äô ‚Äì We always try to understand why our work matters and how it helps others.

¬∑¬†We Embrace Simplicity ‚Äì We like to keep things simple and avoid unnecessary complexity. We believe that simple solutions are often the best.

¬∑¬†We Continuous Improve ‚Äì We're always looking for ways to get better, both in our work and in our personal lives.

¬∑¬†We Care ‚Äì We want to enjoy life and work, we push for results and value, and enjoy flexibility.

¬∑¬†We Figure it Out ‚Äì We look to find our own path and use available resources to make it happen.




*APPLICATION REQUIREMENT* For any applicant to be considered, an email will need to be sent to hr@amplify-solutions.ca explaining their alignment to our ‚ÄòCompany Values‚Äô and how they see themselves being a strong fit at Amplify.

Title: Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Job Description

Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto‚Äôs subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario.

At Metrolinx, equity, diversity and inclusion are essential to living our values of serving with passion, thinking forward and playing as a team.

CPG‚Äôs workforce is made up of driven and dedicated professionals who care deeply about working together to deliver infrastructure and make a positive impact in our communities. Join us as we build a knowledgeable and collaborative team that courageously changes how transit projects will be delivered.

This role is accountable for providing support to the Senior Business Intelligence Developer by assisting with the development of BI tools/applications, reports and transformation of data from source to visualization. This role requires a systematic understanding of the data and the transformation processes which form the foundation of our reporting. It is expected to collaborate with various teams across CPG to establish dynamic reporting, develop KPIs and proactively work towards applying Power Platform tools to enable good-quality data collection, and to improve data transformation/integration efficiency.

What will I be doing?


Lead the design, development, and delivery of Power BI dashboards and reports‚Äîfrom concept to deployment‚Äîensuring alignment with business objectives and stakeholder needs.
Collaborate with Business Analysts and cross-functional teams to gather, analyze, and translate complex business requirements into actionable BI solutions.
Integrate and transform data from multiple sources (on-premises and cloud) using Power Query, DAX, and advanced data modeling techniques to enable effective data visualization and decision-making.
Conduct thorough data profiling, cleansing, and validation to ensure accuracy, consistency, and integrity across reports and dashboards.
Develop complex and interactive visuals that provide actionable insights, support KPI tracking, and drive performance improvement.
Prepare and execute user acceptance testing plans and address issues identified during testing to ensure solution quality and reliability.
Document technical solutions, data models, and development standards in alignment with business requirements and SOPs.
Continuously evaluate and implement emerging BI tools, trends, and best practices to optimize solution design, enhance scalability, and drive innovation in analytics delivery.



What Skills and Qualifications Do I Need?


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related STEM discipline ‚Äî or an equivalent combination of education, training, and professional experience.
Minimum of four (4) years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, and solving complex quantitative business challenges, preferably within the transportation, construction, or public sector industries.
Proven track record in developing interactive dashboards and BI solutions that drive actionable insights. Proficiency in Power BI, including DAX and Power Query (M) is preferred.
Strong experience with database management, data modeling, analytical processing, and ETL/ELT frameworks, including integrating and transforming data from multiple sources.
Familiarity with Power Platform tools (Power Apps, Power Automate) and Microsoft Fabric is considered an asset.
High attention to detail with the ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills, with a proactive approach to continuous improvement and innovation.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to present complex data and insights clearly and effectively to technical and non-technical stakeholders, including senior leadership.



Don‚Äôt Meet Every Requirement?

If you‚Äôre excited about working with Metrolinx but your past experience doesn‚Äôt quite align with every qualification of this posting, we encourage you to apply. You just might be the right candidate for this or other roles. We are always looking for great talent to join our team.

We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from members of equity-deserving communities, including those who identify as Indigenous, Black, racialized, women, people with disabilities, and people with diverse gender identities, expressions and sexual orientations.

Accommodation

We value the unique skills and experiences each person brings to Metrolinx and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. We are committed to the requirements of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act so if you require accommodation during the hiring process, please let our Recruitment team know by contacting us at: 416-202-5601 or email hr.recruitment@metrolinx.com .

Application Process

All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Metrolinx will be using email to communicate with you for all job competitions. It is your responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time-sensitive correspondence, we recommend that you check your email regularly. If no response is received, we will assume you are no longer interested in pursuing the opportunity. Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate.

For Internal applicants, with the recent implementation of the Internal Mobility Policy, the internal recruitment process has changed for non-union roles. Candidates must be in their current role for 12 months prior to applying for another role and each applicant must be in good standing (not participating in a Performance Improvement Plan). Please review all provisions of the policy before submitting your application.

Should it be determined that any background information provided is misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, Metrolinx reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of your application.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

WE ARE AN EQUITABLE AND INCLUSIVE EMPLOYER.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Senior Data Analyst with expertise in Master Data Management (MDM) and a strong understanding of Capital Markets to join our team. The ideal candidate will lead and support the design, implementation, and enhancement of enterprise MDM solutions, ensuring data consistency, integrity, and governance across trading, investment, and risk platforms. This role acts as a critical liaison between business and technology teams to ensure that data assets are effectively managed to support key business functions.

Key Responsibilities:

Partner with business stakeholders across Front Office, Middle Office, and Risk/Compliance to gather and document MDM and data governance requirements.
Lead workshops and working sessions with SMEs to analyze business processes and define master and reference data requirements across domains such as securities, clients, accounts, products, issuers, and counterparties.
Define data quality rules, match/merge logic, survivorship criteria, and stewardship workflows to ensure golden record creation and maintenance.
Support data lineage and metadata capture to ensure transparency, traceability, and auditability of critical data elements (CDEs).
Translate business requirements into functional specifications and work closely with data engineering and MDM development teams to deliver solutions.
Create and maintain business process models, data flow diagrams, and mapping documents for MDM implementations and integrations with downstream systems (e.g., trading platforms, risk systems, CRM).
Work with data stewards and data owners to establish governance frameworks and monitor ongoing data quality and policy adherence.
Support UAT strategy, test case development, and coordination of testing cycles with business users.
Contribute to ongoing MDM strategy and roadmap planning to align with enterprise data initiatives and regulatory requirements (e.g., BCBS 239, MiFID II, SEC rules).
Act as SME for data dependencies and flows across capital market functions and provide recommendations for data optimization.

Required Qualifications:

7+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, including at least 3+ years in Master Data Management projects.
Strong understanding of Capital Markets products (e.g., equities, fixed income, derivatives), trade lifecycle, and front-to-back office operations.
Proven experience with MDM platforms
Hands-on experience with data profiling, data mapping, lineage, and governance tools (e.g., Collibra, Alation).
Familiarity with regulatory compliance and reporting frameworks impacting data management in financial services.
Strong SQL/data analysis skills and the ability to work with large datasets for validation and reconciliation.
Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to operate independently and lead cross-functional initiatives in a dynamic environment.

Preferred Skills:

Experience with agile delivery methodologies (Scrum, SAFe).
Knowledge of cloud-based data architecture (e.g., AWS, Azure, Snowflake) is a plus.
Understanding of data mesh or data fabric concepts.

Title: GCP Data Analyst - BigQuery (Canada)
Description:
About The Role

We‚Äôre seeking a GCP Data Analyst with deep expertise in BigQuery, strong SQL and Python skills, and a sharp analytical mindset to support both data validation initiatives and ongoing analytics work. This role is ideal for someone who can navigate large datasets, build robust queries, and identify inconsistencies with precision and insight.

The analyst will work across a variety of data workflows, from validating metrics during system migrations to supporting day-to-day data analysis and reporting needs. You‚Äôll leverage advanced BigQuery features‚Äîsuch as authorized views, materialized views, UDFs, partitioning strategies, and time series analysis‚Äîto ensure data integrity and surface meaningful insights. Comfort working in Python with data frames and relevant packages is also essential, particularly for tasks involving data manipulation, anomaly detection, or prototyping workflows.

A solid understanding of data engineering fundamentals and GCP infrastructure is important, as is the ability to read and interpret code in Java or Scala when collaborating with engineering teammates. Familiarity with Airflow (Composer) will help you understand orchestration logic, though this won‚Äôt be a core responsibility. Experience with BigQuery ML, anomaly detection frameworks, or Vertex AI is a plus.

Key Responsibilities:-


Write, optimize, and execute complex SQL queries in BigQuery to validate data accuracy, identify inconsistencies, and support analytics and reporting
Analyze large datasets to assess data quality, compare trends across systems, and surface anomalies or unexpected behaviors
Utilize advanced BigQuery features such as authorized views, materialized views, UDFs, partitioned tables, and joins to support scalable, high-performance analysis
Use Python (including data frames and relevant libraries) for exploratory analysis, data manipulation, and supporting validation workflows
Support time series analysis and, where applicable, anomaly detection using SQL or Python-based approaches
Assist with load/transform validation to ensure reliability and accuracy in data pipelines
Collaborate with engineering teams to understand data pipelines, with basic ability to read and interpret Java or Scala code when needed
Perform side-by-side comparisons of data across systems to ensure consistency during and after migrations
Maintain basic familiarity with orchestration tools such as Airflow (Composer) to follow pipeline logic and collaborate effectively with engineering
Work within the GCP environment, leveraging cloud tools and services to support analysis, troubleshoot issues, and navigate cloud-based workflows
Clearly communicate analytical findings and data quality issues to cross-functional stakeholders to support decision-making



Qualifications:-


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field
5+ years of experience in data analyst or analytics engineering roles with strong BigQuery, SQL, and Python skills
5+ years of experience building and operating solutions on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Strong ability to write and optimize SQL queries to validate data, analyze trends, and detect inconsistencies
Proficient in Python, including use of data frames and common analytical libraries
Experience with advanced BigQuery features such as authorized views, materialized views, UDFs, partitions, and time series analysis
Strong analytical skills and experience validating data across systems during migrations and ongoing operations
Basic ability to read and understand Java or Scala code to support engineering collaboration
Familiarity with Airflow (Cloud Composer) to interpret and trace data pipeline workflows



Nice to have:-


Familiarity with Looker or other BI tools for metric validation and reporting support
BigQuery ML and Vertex AI
Basic familiarity with legacy systems such as Oozie or Pig for reading existing scripts



Must have's:-


Proficiency in SQL, BigQuery, and Python
Advanced SQL skills in BigQuery for complex data validation, anomaly detection, and trend analysis
Experience comparing datasets across systems
Proven ability to identify and investigate data discrepancies across platforms
Strong analytical intuition to sense-check metrics and flag issues that may not trigger formal alerts
Ability to perform side-by-side metric and trend comparisons to confirm post-migration accuracy
Skilled in root cause analysis using SQL, domain expertise, and supporting context
Effective communicator who can document findings and share insights with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Familiarity with time series analysis to detect unexpected shifts, drops, or spikes in metrics
Ability to follow structured validation processes while proactively identifying workflow improvements



Travel:-


As per business requirements



The following information is required by pay transparency legislation in the following states: CA, CO, HI, NY, and WA. This information applies only to individuals working in these states.


The anticipated starting pay range for Colorado is: $ 143,700 - $ 210,760
The anticipated starting pay range for the states of Hawaii and New York (not including NYC) is: $ 153,000 - $ 224,400
The anticipated starting pay range for California, New York City and Washington is: $ 167,400 - $ 245,520



Unless already included in the posted pay range and based on eligibility, the role may include variable compensation in the form of bonus, commissions, or other discretionary payments. These discretionary payments are based on company and/or individual performance and may change at any time. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, licenses and certifications, and specific work location. Information on benefits offered is here.

About Rackspace Technology

We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world‚Äôs leading technologies ‚Äî across applications, data and security ‚Äî to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.

More on Rackspace Technology

Though we‚Äôre all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. We welcome you to apply today and want you to know that we are committed to offering equal employment opportunity without regard to age, color, disability, gender reassignment or identity or expression, genetic information, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity status, military or veteran status, nationality, ethnic or national origin, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or any legally protected characteristic. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst, Ecommerce




Overview

We‚Äôre looking for a BI Analyst to build and scale our reporting infrastructure, surface insights that drive strategic decisions, and empower cross-functional teams to work confidently with data. You‚Äôll own the way we track and understand performance in a fast-moving DTC e-commerce environment.




About Jewlr

Personalized Jewelry, designed by you.




At Jewlr, we invite you into a world of possibility, a creative destination to freely discover and design jewelry that is uniquely, and meaningfully yours. Our jewelry is a celebration and a genuine reflection of who you are ‚Äî your beliefs, your loves, your experiences, and your milestones. Explore endless styles and customize to mark your moments, give thoughtfully, and play with personality.




The winner of the 2013 Canada Post's Most Innovative Large Retailer Award, Jewlr's combination of innovative custom design technology with traditional hand made manufacturing delivers high quality jewelry that transforms your memories into timeless pieces.

Headquartered in Toronto, Canada, Jewlr was founded in 2009 with the mission to create a truly unique online experience where you choose, personalize, and customize fine jewelry.




Today, Jewlr is an internationally recognized brand employing more than 150 people and has shipped more than 1.5 million orders. Jewlr continues to grow exponentially year-by-year and has redefined the international standard for personalized jewelry.




JOIN OUR TEAM

Ever wanted to be a part of something bigger? We're working towards a fresh new look and want to hear from you!




Key Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain core reporting infrastructure in BigQuery and Looker Studio (or similar tools).
Define and own dashboards and reports for KPIs like CVR, AOV, LTV, CAC, retention, and channel performance.
Conduct e-commerce performance analysis by tracking KPIs such as traffic, conversion rates, cart abandonment, AOV, and sales to generate actionable insights.
Regularly produce clear, actionable business insights and reports on e-commerce performance, marketing campaigns, product launches, and customer behavior.
Partner with stakeholders across marketing, merchandising, CX, product, IT, engineering, and executive teams to understand needs and enable self-serve reporting.
Provide documentation and analytical support for Shopify Plus, CMS, ERP, WMS and other systems that support the business.
Design and implement standardized templates and best practices for documenting business processes and performance reporting.
Ensure consistency of metrics definitions and data accuracy across the organization.
Assist with forecasting financial and performance metrics to support strategic planning and goal-setting.
Review and update documentation regularly to maintain accuracy, clarity, and completeness.
Identify and propose improvements to documentation processes to enhance quality and efficiency.
Document data sources, reporting logic, and dashboard usage best practices.




Qualifications & Skills

3‚Äì5+ years of experience in BI, analytics, or data-focused roles, preferably in a DTC or e-commerce setting on Shopify Plus.
Strong SQL skills and experience with data warehouses like BigQuery.
Proficient in BI tools such as Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Proficient in Ecommerce BI tools such as Triple Whale, Polar Analytics and Elevar.
Solid understanding of standard e-commerce KPIs and how to track them effectively.
Strong communication skills and the ability to turn complex data into simple business narratives.
Self-starter with the ability to proactively identify opportunities and deliver solutions.




This is a full-time hybrid position based in Toronto.




Jewlr is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion and

providing a workplace that is free from discrimination. Jewlr is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. Such accommodation is available on request in respect of all aspects of the recruitment, assessment and selection process and may be requested by emailing help@jewlr.com.
