Title: GCP Data Analyst - BigQuery (Canada)
Description:
About The Role

We‚Äôre seeking a GCP Data Analyst with deep expertise in BigQuery, strong SQL and Python skills, and a sharp analytical mindset to support both data validation initiatives and ongoing analytics work. This role is ideal for someone who can navigate large datasets, build robust queries, and identify inconsistencies with precision and insight.

The analyst will work across a variety of data workflows, from validating metrics during system migrations to supporting day-to-day data analysis and reporting needs. You‚Äôll leverage advanced BigQuery features‚Äîsuch as authorized views, materialized views, UDFs, partitioning strategies, and time series analysis‚Äîto ensure data integrity and surface meaningful insights. Comfort working in Python with data frames and relevant packages is also essential, particularly for tasks involving data manipulation, anomaly detection, or prototyping workflows.

A solid understanding of data engineering fundamentals and GCP infrastructure is important, as is the ability to read and interpret code in Java or Scala when collaborating with engineering teammates. Familiarity with Airflow (Composer) will help you understand orchestration logic, though this won‚Äôt be a core responsibility. Experience with BigQuery ML, anomaly detection frameworks, or Vertex AI is a plus.

Key Responsibilities:-


Write, optimize, and execute complex SQL queries in BigQuery to validate data accuracy, identify inconsistencies, and support analytics and reporting
Analyze large datasets to assess data quality, compare trends across systems, and surface anomalies or unexpected behaviors
Utilize advanced BigQuery features such as authorized views, materialized views, UDFs, partitioned tables, and joins to support scalable, high-performance analysis
Use Python (including data frames and relevant libraries) for exploratory analysis, data manipulation, and supporting validation workflows
Support time series analysis and, where applicable, anomaly detection using SQL or Python-based approaches
Assist with load/transform validation to ensure reliability and accuracy in data pipelines
Collaborate with engineering teams to understand data pipelines, with basic ability to read and interpret Java or Scala code when needed
Perform side-by-side comparisons of data across systems to ensure consistency during and after migrations
Maintain basic familiarity with orchestration tools such as Airflow (Composer) to follow pipeline logic and collaborate effectively with engineering
Work within the GCP environment, leveraging cloud tools and services to support analysis, troubleshoot issues, and navigate cloud-based workflows
Clearly communicate analytical findings and data quality issues to cross-functional stakeholders to support decision-making



Qualifications:-


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field
5+ years of experience in data analyst or analytics engineering roles with strong BigQuery, SQL, and Python skills
5+ years of experience building and operating solutions on Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Strong ability to write and optimize SQL queries to validate data, analyze trends, and detect inconsistencies
Proficient in Python, including use of data frames and common analytical libraries
Experience with advanced BigQuery features such as authorized views, materialized views, UDFs, partitions, and time series analysis
Strong analytical skills and experience validating data across systems during migrations and ongoing operations
Basic ability to read and understand Java or Scala code to support engineering collaboration
Familiarity with Airflow (Cloud Composer) to interpret and trace data pipeline workflows



Nice to have:-


Familiarity with Looker or other BI tools for metric validation and reporting support
BigQuery ML and Vertex AI
Basic familiarity with legacy systems such as Oozie or Pig for reading existing scripts



Must have's:-


Proficiency in SQL, BigQuery, and Python
Advanced SQL skills in BigQuery for complex data validation, anomaly detection, and trend analysis
Experience comparing datasets across systems
Proven ability to identify and investigate data discrepancies across platforms
Strong analytical intuition to sense-check metrics and flag issues that may not trigger formal alerts
Ability to perform side-by-side metric and trend comparisons to confirm post-migration accuracy
Skilled in root cause analysis using SQL, domain expertise, and supporting context
Effective communicator who can document findings and share insights with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Familiarity with time series analysis to detect unexpected shifts, drops, or spikes in metrics
Ability to follow structured validation processes while proactively identifying workflow improvements



Travel:-


As per business requirements

The anticipated starting pay range for Colorado is: $ 143,700 - $ 210,760
The anticipated starting pay range for the states of Hawaii and New York (not including NYC) is: $ 153,000 - $ 224,400
The anticipated starting pay range for California, New York City and Washington is: $ 167,400 - $ 245,520

These discretionary payments are based on company and/or individual performance and may change at any time. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Computer Generated Solutions, Inc.

Data Analyst‚Äì Full Time

Computer Generated Solutions ‚Äì Canada

Saint John, NB

Corporate Profile

CGS Canada, a division of Computer-Generated Solutions, Inc., is home to the Learning Development and Channel services team. We provide custom learning solutions, channel partner enablement services and applications development. Since 1984, CGS has been delivering expert, cross-industry solutions across multiple platforms. To learn more about us, visit www.cgsinc.com

Job Description:

Build strong working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Prepare and distribute daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly analysis to stakeholders and management by utilizing information gathered from various data sources / reports, including Snowflake and other enterprise data platforms.
Update and maintain reporting metrics as required.
Help build visualization / standard sets of reports in SFDC, Tableau, or Excel / PPT (prefer Google Sheets and Google Slides) that can be replicated by geos for further distribution.
Utilize Python to automate data extraction, transformation, and reporting workflows, improving efficiency and reducing manual work.
Synthesize and distill a wide range of data and information into workable, actionable items and reports.
Continuously look to improve current reporting practices and concepts, including exploring Snowflake and Python-based solutions.
Complete ad-hoc reporting requests from different teams in a timely manner.

Requirements / Skills:

3-year College Diploma or University Degree in Business or Technology-related field, or combination of education and experience.
Comfortable working with large volumes of data and connecting disparate data sources, including SQL-based data warehouses such as Snowflake.
Advanced and strong experience working with Tableau, SFDC, Excel, PPT, and Python for data analysis and automation.
Experience writing SQL queries to extract and manipulate data within Snowflake.
Team-player: eager to build positive and productive relationships with diverse stakeholders.
Ability to communicate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization and to build strong interpersonal relationships.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment where you learn quickly and manage multiple activities together.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Determined. Imaginative. Curious. If these are some of the ways you describe yourself ‚Äî we want to learn more about you! At TC Energy, we are Energy Problem Solvers ‚Äî passionate about transitioning North America to cleaner energy while meeting the energy demands of today and tomorrow. If that sounds like a challenge you want to help tackle, we want you to join our team!

The Opportunity

TC Energy‚Äôs External Relations group in Canada is currently looking to hire a Data Analyst, which can be based in Vancouver, B.C., Calgary, A.B., or Toronto, O.N.

Reporting to the Manager, Strategy, Governance & Planning, this role will be central to enabling our team‚Äôs digital transformation to support stakeholder engagement, communications, and regulatory reporting. They will support the team‚Äôs strategic objectives by building and analyzing datasets; developing and implementing technology tools; and creating reporting products that track our performance. They will have the opportunity to design, build, and maintain a technical stack that prioritizes end-users and delivers strategic outcomes.

The ideal candidate is someone who thrives at the intersection of data, technology, and external relations. They are experts at building and analyzing stakeholder datasets; able to articulate complex reports into clear and concise metrics that drive decisions; have experience working with consultant developers; and have a passion for AI and innovative solutions.

We are looking for someone who brings not only technical expertise but also a sense of curiosity ‚Äî someone who asks the right questions, explores possibilities, and thoughtfully implements technology that fits the business context. This role will have the ability to make a real impact by transforming the ways we work as one team and ultimately support our mission of building and sustaining support for TC Energy‚Äôs projects and operations.

‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

What you‚Äôll do‚ÄØ


Design, configure, and maintain Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM solutions in partnership with consultant developers to support business processes across departments.
Build, manage, report, and illustrate datasets using Power BI or other data visualization platforms.
Bring data to life through visual tools to tell a compelling narrative that supports internal and external decisions.
Build and maintain solutions using Dataverse, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and Power Pages with the purpose of translating data into actionable insights.
Develop and maintain our Monday.com project management tool, with a focus on simplifying our use of the platform.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders across External Relations Canada and TC Energy to gather requirements, translate them into technical specifications, and deliver scalable solutions that meet our strategic objectives.
Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance across CRM and BI platforms.
Provide end-user training and support to maximize adoption and value realization.



Minimum Qualifications‚ÄØ


3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or database management, using visualization platforms tools like Power BI.
Intermediate experience with CRM systems, particularly Microsoft Dynamics 365 (Sales, Customer Insights: Journeys, or related modules).
Strong understanding of Dataverse schema design and data modeling.
Proficiency in Power Apps (Canvas and Model-Driven), Power Automate, Power BI, Power Pages, and Customer Insights ‚Äì Journeys.
Familiarity with Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) principles and hands-on experience using Azure DevOps for solution deployments.
Awareness of data governance, privacy, and compliance considerations in technology implementations.
Strong analytical, curious, and problem-solving mindset to explore, question, and thoughtfully implement technology in alignment with business processes.
Ability to write clear functional documentation and user stories.
Proven communication skills to translate data and technical concepts to into actionable insights
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Systems, Information Systems, Statistics or a related field (equivalent work experience with demonstrated expertise in Power BI, Dynamics 365 and the Power Platform will also be considered).



Preferred Qualifications‚ÄØ


Strong understanding of business processes in corporate services, operations, or energy sectors.
Basic coding skills (e.g., JavaScript, C#, Power Fx) to support more complex scenarios.
Familiarity with Microsoft 365 ecosystem and integration points.
Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., Monday.com).
Preferred certifications:
Microsoft Certified: Power BI (PL-300)
Microsoft Certified: Power Platform Functional Consultant Associate (PL-200)
Microsoft Certified: Power Platform App Maker Associate (PL-100)
Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Customer Insights (Journeys) Functional Consultant Associate (MB-220)
Microsoft Certified: Customer Data Platform Specialty (MB-260)

To remain competitive, support our high-performance culture and allow for more flexibility in the way we work, we offer a hybrid work model and flexible dress code for our eligible office-based workforce in Canada, the U.S. and Mexico.

About Our Business

TC Energy is a leading energy infrastructure company in North America. We have complementary businesses of natural gas pipelines and power generation. Our operations span three countries, seven Canadian provinces, and 34 U.S. states.

TC Energy is an equal opportunity employer.

Learn more

Visit us at TCEnergy.com and connect with us on our social media channels for our latest news, employee stories, community activities, and other updates.

Thank you for choosing TC Energy in your career search.


Depending on qualifications, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or ladder.
Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no restrictions.
All positions require background screening. Some require criminal and/or credit checks to comply with regulations.
TC Energy is committed to provide employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@tcenergy.com.

They are experts at building and analyzing stakeholder datasets; able to articulate complex reports into clear and concise metrics that drive decisions; have experience working with consultant developers; and have a passion for AI and innovative solutions.

We are looking for someone who brings not only technical expertise but also a sense of curiosity ‚Äî someone who asks the right questions, explores possibilities, and thoughtfully implements technology that fits the business context. This role will have the ability to make a real impact by transforming the ways we work as one team and ultimately support our mission of building and sustaining support for TC Energy‚Äôs projects and operations.

‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

What you‚Äôll do‚ÄØ

  • Design, configure, and maintain Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM solutions in partnership with consultant developers to support business processes across departments.
  • Build, manage, report, and illustrate datasets using Power BI or other data visualization platforms.
  • Bring data to life through visual tools to tell a compelling narrative that supports internal and external decisions.
  • Build and maintain solutions using Dataverse, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and Power Pages with the purpose of translating data into actionable insights.
  • Develop and maintain our Monday.com project management tool, with a focus on simplifying our use of the platform.
  • Collaborate with internal stakeholders across External Relations Canada and TC Energy to gather requirements, translate them into technical specifications, and deliver scalable solutions that meet our strategic objectives.
  • Ensure data integrity, security, and compliance across CRM and BI platforms.
  • Provide end-user training and support to maximize adoption and value realization.


Minimum Qualifications‚ÄØ

  • 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or database management, using visualization platforms tools like Power BI.
  • Intermediate experience with CRM systems, particularly Microsoft Dynamics 365 (Sales, Customer Insights: Journeys, or related modules).
  • Strong understanding of Dataverse schema design and data modeling.
  • Proficiency in Power Apps (Canvas and Model-Driven), Power Automate, Power BI, Power Pages, and Customer Insights ‚Äì Journeys.
  • Familiarity with Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) principles and hands-on experience using Azure DevOps for solution deployments.
  • Awareness of data governance, privacy, and compliance considerations in technology implementations.
  • Strong analytical, curious, and problem-solving mindset to explore, question, and thoughtfully implement technology in alignment with business processes.
  • Ability to write clear functional documentation and user stories.
  • Proven communication skills to translate data and technical concepts to into actionable insights
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Systems, Information Systems, Statistics or a related field (equivalent work experience with demonstrated expertise in Power BI, Dynamics 365 and the Power Platform will also be considered).


Preferred Qualifications‚ÄØ

  • Strong understanding of business processes in corporate services, operations, or energy sectors.
  • Basic coding skills (e.g., JavaScript, C#, Power Fx) to support more complex scenarios.
  • Familiarity with Microsoft 365 ecosystem and integration points.
  • Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., Monday.com).
  • Preferred certifications:
    • Microsoft Certified: Power BI (PL-300)
    • Microsoft Certified: Power Platform Functional Consultant Associate (PL-200)
    • Microsoft Certified: Power Platform App Maker Associate (PL-100)
    • Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Customer Insights (Journeys) Functional Consultant Associate (MB-220)
    • Microsoft Certified: Customer Data Platform Specialty (MB-260)
To remain competitive, support our high-performance culture and allow for more flexibility in the way we work, we offer a hybrid work model and flexible dress code for our eligible office-based workforce in Canada, the U.S. and Mexico.

About Our Business

TC Energy is a leading energy infrastructure company in North America. We have complementary businesses of natural gas pipelines and power generation. Our operations span three countries, seven Canadian provinces, and 34 U.S. states.

TC Energy is an equal opportunity employer.

Learn more

Visit us at TCEnergy.com and connect with us on our social media channels for our latest news, employee stories, community activities, and other updates.

Thank you for choosing TC Energy in your career search.

  • Depending on qualifications, the successful candidate may be offered a position at a more appropriate level and/or ladder.
  • Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the country in which the position is based with no restrictions.
  • All positions require background screening. Some require criminal and/or credit checks to comply with regulations.
  • TC Energy is committed to provide employment opportunities to all qualified individuals, without regard to race, religion, age, sex, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available on request during the recruitment process. Applicants with disabilities can request accessible formats or communication supports by contacting careers@tcenergy.com.

Title: Consumer Insights Analyst
Description:
SATOV Consultants¬†‚Äì¬†Toronto, ON M5H 3B3




POSTING DATE: August 13, 2025




Company Overview




SATOV is a growing management consulting firm based in Toronto. Founded in 2002, the firm is recognized as the leading boutique strategy consultancy in Canada. Our work spans growth strategy, operational excellence and M&A advisory. In addition to a group of recurring corporate clients, we have a strong and growing private equity practice with funds in Canada and the United States.¬†




The SATOV value proposition is based on providing top-tier expertise with a practical edge: advice is valuable, but help is better.




Our internal culture is intense and performance-driven, but also close-knit and familial. Employees at all levels work together very closely on projects. The leadership of the firm is transparent about the strategy and operations of the firm. Team members are expected to participate frequently in business development and other firm-building activities.¬†¬†




Our in-house research team plays a pivotal role in driving insight-led strategies that guide major investment and business decisions. Our clients are in the consumer goods and retail sectors along with chain healthcare, and real estate. We also partner with our strategy clients to serve private equity firms and their portfolio companies.




Responsibility Overview




As a Consumer Insights Analyst at SATOV, you will play a crucial role in our projects, taking ownership of substantial research workstreams and demonstrating proficiency in storytelling and insights related to critical consumer research, including social trends, statistics, and modeling. You will work closely with other analysts, managers, or partners to set project parameters and touch points, gradually working more independently to deliver comprehensive solutions to our clients.




You will be responsible for hands-on, end-to-end project involvement, from proposal or brief to final report. We prioritize providing practical advice based on strong analytics.




Additionally, you will engage in qualitative research, including IDIs, focus groups, and ethnographies. This will involve project design, recruiting, moderating, engaging participants, analyzing and reporting findings.




What You‚Äôll Bring

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Experience working in a consumer research company

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Good understanding of consumer research process

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Undergraduate or postgraduate degree

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong competency in Excel, PowerPoint, Displayr (or SPSS)

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong organizational skills, especially in self-organization and time management

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong analytical skills and the ability to craft compelling narratives

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Excellent written and verbal communication skills to convey complex analyses and insights effectively

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Perseverance and goal orientation, with a focus on delivering high-quality outcomes for clients and the firm

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Strong research capabilities to gather and synthesize relevant information

If you are ready to make an impact and contribute to transformative strategies for leading organizations, we invite you to apply and join our passionate team at SATOV Consultants!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Competitive, plus participation in company-wide bonus program

Benefits:

Dental care
Long Term Disability insurance
Extended health care
Paid time off

Work Location: In person. You will be expected to be in the office 3 or more days per week




Application deadline: August 29, 2025

Expected start date: TBD




Application requirements

SATOV WEBSITE POSTING

Send application materials to: insights@satovconsultants.com




Resume
Cover letter that outlines why you want to join our firm and answers one or both of the following:
Client Project: Describe one project you have worked on over the past 12-18 months that was interesting to you. What was the problem, the research path and outcome? Why was this interesting to you?
Future of Consumer Insight Research: What 2-3 changes, if any, do you see in the consumer insight industry in the short-term? Beyond or considering aggregators, DIY platforms, growing AI capabilities what is next for our industry?

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Overview

BET99 is Canada's Premiere Online Sportsbook and Casino. Launching in 2020, we have consistently innovated the online gaming landscape every step of the way, exponentially growing our customer base and, in turn, our internal BET99 team!




As a Senior Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be at the forefront of strategic decision-making - turning complex data into insights that drive business success. You bring deep analytical expertise, curiosity to explore complex problems, and a drive to help teams make better decisions. In our fast-paced online sports-book and casino environment, you‚Äôll lead high-impact analytical initiatives, design scalable solutions, and influence how data informs decisions across the business. You‚Äôll also mentor analysts, advocate for data-driven thinking, and contribute to a culture of excellence grounded in challenging the status quo, trust, transparency, integrity, and collaboration.




Responsibilities:

Partner with stakeholders to gather requirements, define analytical goals, and translate business questions into data solutions.
Apply advanced statistical methods and exploratory analysis to guide strategic decisions in product, marketing, and player engagement
Use Python (and PySpark where appropriate) to clean, transform, and analyze large, complex datasets.
Design and scale dashboards and reporting frameworks in Power BI to support business visibility and planning.
Lead analyses of player behaviour and marketing campaign performance, including segmentation, lifecycle modelling, and retention optimization.
Write and optimize complex SQL queries to extract and structure data from various sources.
Communicate findings clearly through strategic recommendations tailored for senior stakeholders.
Define and track core business metrics; design and evaluate A/B tests and experiments.
Mentor junior analysts, contribute to technical development, and uphold quality through code reviews.
Drive automation and scalable reporting solutions to improve efficiency and reliability.
Ensure outputs are accurate, validated, reproducible, and actionable.




Skills and Qualifications:

5+ years of experience in data analytics, ideally in online gaming, sports-book, or digital consumer sectors.
Hands-on experience with marketing analytics, including campaign performance analysis, customer segmentation, and lifecycle insights.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science).
Advanced knowledge of statistical techniques including A/B testing, experimental design, and predictive modelling.
Expertise in SQL and Python; PySpark experience preferred.
Proven experience designing and building effective dashboards in Power BI or equivalent tools.
Familiarity with modern cloud data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Databricks).
Strong project ownership and ability to manage multiple complex initiatives.
Experience mentoring team members or leading technical efforts.
Exceptional communication and storytelling skills, especially for non-technical audiences.
High standards of accuracy, integrity, and continuous improvement.

Title: Data Analyst - Digital
Description:
GENERAL FUNCTION

Momentum's Analytics team is looking for a Data Analyst ‚Äì Digital to join our growing Analytics Team. This individual will be the key person for consulting with the business to share data insights providing solutions, reports and strategies to grow our Digital market and associated products. Reporting directly to the Senior Manager of Analytics, the Data Analyst ‚Äì Digital will be the data subject matter expert for all Digital platforms and products, working closely with the product and marketing department. In addition to sharing data insights, the individual will have opportunities to work closely with business leaders in presenting findings and formulating data supported strategies.

If you see analytics as an opportunity to solve problems, build relationships, drive business and have fun while doing it, you've come to the right place.

DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES


Leverage data expertise to analyze a wide spectrum of data to provide insights and solutions to the business.
Identify and improve inefficiencies or issues in current data processes and reports with a "there's always room for improvement" mindset.
Conceive, design & develop purpose focused reports and dashboards that drives value and meets business needs
Manipulate large data sets from multiple sources to provide business metric reporting
Communicate concise and actionable business strategies from vast amounts of data for Sr. Management.


EDUCATION


Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Decision Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Engineering, Finance, or Economics


EXPERIENCE


Experience or knowledge of reporting, analysis and strategy development in the financial services industry, with a strong passion to learn and improve.
Experience or knowledge of digital market trends and strategies, such as running digital-only marketing campaigns, launching digital specific products, capturing and analyzing data from digital platforms.
Experience using Google Analytics, GA4 and Big Query
Proven experience using SQL, R, Python, or similar data mining and analytics applications.
Experience with Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft SSRS or other tools.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Capable of completing descriptive, diagnostic, exploratory, predictive, and prescriptive analytical exercises.
Proven ability to effectively analyze and interpret large amounts of raw data to accurately convey business needs.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, and ability to simply explain complex information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Strong work ethic, curious and persistent determination in reviewing and reconciling variances.
Ability to work autonomously as well as in a team setting.
Aptitude and willingness to roll-up the sleeves and get involved in the details.
Highly curious with the desire to go deep beneath the surface to solve problems.
Good business judgment with demonstrated ability to think creatively and strategically.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Inclusion without Exception




Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an equal opportunity employer, and embraces diversity in race, nationality, ethnicity, gender, age, physical ability, neurodiversity, and sexual orientation, to create a workforce that reflects the societies we operate in. Our continued commitment to Culture and Diversity is reflected in our people‚Äôs stories across our workforce and implemented through equitable workplace policies and processes.




TCS is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world‚Äôs largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive-powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile‚Ñ¢ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS operates in 55 countries and employs over 607,000 highly skilled individuals, including more than 10,000 in Canada. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $30 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2025, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.




Job Description:

Must Have Technical/Functional Skills

‚Ä¢ 5+years with Data Analyst experience andshould be able to collect, Process and analyze large financial datasets

‚Ä¢ Interpret data trends and patterns toprovide actionable insights

‚Ä¢ Proficient/advanced SQL skills with the ability to write and optimize queries.

‚Ä¢ Capital markets /banking domain exp, Knowledge in banking products, payment domain, regulatory reporting, data analytics

‚Ä¢ Expertise in data analysis and ability to interpret financial datasets.

‚Ä¢ Experience in business analysis, requirement gathering, and process optimization.

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Excel, BI tools, or other data visualization platforms is a plus.

‚Ä¢ 10+ years‚Äô experience with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), core data management, data quality and governance experience.

‚Ä¢ 6 + years of experience in Financial Services required

‚Ä¢ Demonstrate leadership in managing large and complex regulatory and data transformation programs

‚Ä¢ Understanding of products including Banking, Global Markets, Loans, Commercial Banking and Services.

‚Ä¢ 5+ years defining use cases to articulate new functional software needs and the roles of each class of application usage.

‚Ä¢ 2+ years‚Äô experience with SharePoint, JIRA, and Confluence

‚Ä¢ 3+ years‚Äô experience working with SQL, data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI for reporting and metrics.

‚Ä¢ Very strong written and oral executive communication skills.

‚Ä¢ Utilize in-depth knowledge of concepts and procedures given the scale of systems and data landscape including data acquisition, CDO and technical teams, the ideal person will have very good mix of functional and technical skills to implement solution for data provisioning, data governance and data consumption for all regulatory and management reports.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with stakeholders/partners to take forward data strategies and be engaged with them continuously to support new data demand onboarding to the Data fabric.

‚Ä¢ Becomes a resident expert in the Technology Data plan and the target state architecture to enable the ability to drive execution progress and remove obstacles with authority

‚Ä¢ Provides IT strategic direction for projects managed including developing detailed IT work plans, schedules, project estimates, resource plans, tracking of plans, risks/issues/dependencies and providing status reports.

Its consulting-led, cognitive-powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile‚Ñ¢ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS operates in 55 countries and employs over 607,000 highly skilled individuals, including more than 10,000 in Canada. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ameresco, Inc. (NYSE:AMRC) is a leading energy solutions provider dedicated to helping customers reduce costs, enhance resilience, and decarbonize to net zero in the global energy transition. We are a trusted, full-service partner to public sector and government entities, K-12 schools, higher education, utilities, and healthcare customers across the U.S., Canada, the U.K., and Europe.

At Ameresco, we show the way by developing, constructing and operating tailored smart energy efficiency solutions, distributed energy resources, and infrastructure upgrades that drive cost savings, resilience, decarbonization, and innovation. Our comprehensive portfolio is built to address the challenges of today and adapt the future, ensuring long-term sustainability and success for our customers.

Ameresco has an immediate opening for a Data Analyst. The position is a 12 Month Contract position. This position will support the implementation and delivery of the AssetPlanner¬Æ software suite. This role involves data entry, analysis, software configuration, client support, and training. The successful candidate will work closely with internal teams and clients to ensure high-quality data and effective software use.

Responsibilities:


Enter and analyze data related to building structures and systems.
Respond to client requests for data updates, support, and configuration changes.
Provide client support via the support line, service request database, and perform annual client check-ins as required.
Conduct phone interviews with clients to gather information on capital assets and input data into the AssetPlanner¬Æ software.
Perform quality assurance reviews of building condition assessment data to ensure alignment with established standards.
Review and input existing client data and documentation.
Assist in developing client-facing reports and presentations.
Support software implementation, including database configuration, client onboarding, and training sessions.
Participate in software testing, provide enhancement suggestions, and report bugs.
Provide support for the Energy and Maintenance modules as needed.


Minimum Qualifications:


University degree.


Additional Qualifications:


Engineering degree/certification a plus.
Experience working with data in an analyst role.
Background in facilities management, building science, or engineering is an asset.
Experience in client or customer service roles.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and MS Office products.
Experience with asset management software is an asset.
Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new software applications.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Professional, courteous, and client-focused demeanor.


Ameresco Canada Inc. is committed to providing accommodations for applicants with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION




Insight Global is seeking a Sr. Data Analyst for one of Canada's top insurance companies. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will contribute by working on complex data analysis projects while also supporting your team through coaching on the use of data analytics. You will demonstrate critical judgment in determining how a business objective can be addressed and decompose complex problems or high-level business objectives into smaller problems that can be solved using data analytics.







REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE




- 5+ years experience in BI or a related field

- Strong understanding of data analysis, programming/tools, data warehouse/data management, and data modeling

- Experience in end-to-end production implementation process for analytical solutions

- Power BI or MicroStrategy

- Excellent communication skills







NICE TO HAVE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE




- Microsoft Power Platform or PowerApps

- Insurance experience

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Work with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of existing data processes and recommend improvements.
Conduct root cause analysis and present findings to cross-functional teams.
Maintain data integrity and quality across all systems and reports.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.
Attention to detail and high level of accuracy. Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Excel.
Strong knowledge of SQL, Excel, and at least one data visualization tool (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About GoBolt

Our Mission:

At GoBolt, we provide a technology-driven, customer-centric and sustainable approach to ecommerce and last-mile logistics for businesses of all sizes ‚Äì from local brands to large national retailers. By operating as an extension of our customer's team, we deliver best-in-class services every step of the way.

We're building North America‚Äôs largest electric vehicle fleet to help bring sustainability to an industry notorious for its heavy impact on the environment. We are in high growth mode and building for the future, which is where you come in!

We are on the lookout for a skilled, operationally minded, Data Analyst. This role will play a critical role in building and owning dashboards, metrics, and data models to support our operations and account management teams.

You will be responsible for deeply understanding our core metrics and ensuring we have actionable and insightful dashboards and data models to support our business. This includes dashboard development, data modelling, data cleanup, and ad-hoc analysis and reporting. This role will work very closely with our operations team and require some time spent in our warehouses.

What You'll Do

Develop and Maintain Our Data Platform:


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and maintain our analytics platform.
Identify and source new data to enrich our existing data platform.
Partner with our data and engineering teams to build data pipelines and integrations for seamless data ingestion.
Implement data governance practices to ensure data quality, consistency, and security.


Measure And Report On Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


Maintain our source of truth documentation for KPI definitions and data sources across the business.
Ensure core dashboards are well-maintained and groomed to reduce conflicting information, streamline data usage, and drive actionable insights.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to support operational efficiency and revenue retention.


Troubleshoot And Clean Up Data


Monitor the data platform for bugs, anomalies, or data quality issues.
Investigate and troubleshoot issues related to data accuracy, completeness, or consistency.
Conduct data cleaning and normalization to ensure data integrity and reliability.


What We're Looking For


2-3 years of experience as a data analyst or in a similar role.
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying, transforming, and manipulating data
Experience with dbt (data build tool) for modular and version-controlled data transformations
Experience with a Business Intelligence tool: You are comfortable building dashboards and reports in BI tools(Looker, Tableau, Mode, Metabase etc.). We use Looker at GoBolt
Familiarity with version control, with a working knowledge of Git for collaborative development.
A background in Computer Science, Analytics, or a related field.
Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Bonus Points For


Experience with operations and logistics, having handled data related to inventory, warehousing, last-mile delivery, and transportation.
Familiarity with data modeling concepts and best practices, especially within a supply chain or logistics context.
Proficiency in Python and scripting, including integrating data from external sources.
A willingness to go deep into our operations to understand processes and metrics and help shape their development over time.
Experience with cloud computing platforms like GCP or AWS


Why Us?

We are innovative, goal-oriented, and are always on the search for energetic and passionate people who are eager to learn and would like to have a rare opportunity to grow within one of the fastest growing scale ups in Canada.

Our team is full of talented and passionate individuals who enjoy working collaboratively within a competitive environment. We will provide you support from the get-go to help you realize your potential. We embrace all kinds of challenges head-on.

Aside from an amazing company culture, we also offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision plans for you and your family.

GoBolt is an equal opportunity employer that recognizes the value and importance of a diverse workforce. We are committed to providing assistance during all phases of the employment cycle, including recruiting through to the end of the employment relationship. If you require accommodation because of injury, illness or disability during any portion of GoBolt‚Äôs recruiting process, please let us know by contacting your recruiter point of contact, and we will do everything we can to accommodate you.

Title: Junior Data Reporting Analyst (100% Remote)
Description:
Junior Data Reporting Analyst ‚Äî Remote

Join a leading insurance provider in their Group Benefits Business Analytics & Advice team. This position offers a fully remote setup within Canada, exposure to client-facing analytics work, and the chance to grow technical and business expertise. You will gain hands-on experience in reporting, data governance, and customer engagement while being part of a collaborative, growth-oriented team.

What is in it for you:

‚Ä¢ Hourly salary of $25-30, based on experience.
‚Ä¢ Full-time position: 37.50 hours per week.
‚Ä¢ Location: Fully Remote (Canada-based, EST hours between 7 AM ‚Äì 6 PM).
‚Ä¢ Schedule: Monday to Friday, 7.5 hours/day (flexible start/end times).
‚Ä¢ Duration: 1 year, with potential for extension or full-time conversion.

Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Communicate with internal and external stakeholders to gather data requirements.
‚Ä¢ Prioritize and manage customer reporting needs.
‚Ä¢ Generate and deliver reports accurately, escalating issues where required.
‚Ä¢ Expand technical and Group Benefits knowledge to enhance reporting capabilities.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with teammates to improve reporting processes.
‚Ä¢ Support data governance within Group Benefits by ensuring reporting accuracy and consistency.

What you will need to succeed:

‚Ä¢ Undergraduate degree preferred, ideally with a focus or strong interest in data and analytics.
‚Ä¢ 0‚Äì2 years of experience (open to new graduates).
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Power BI.
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
‚Ä¢ Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
‚Ä¢ Effective prioritization and organizational skills.
‚Ä¢ Ability to build positive internal business relationships.
‚Ä¢ Team-oriented mindset with a commitment to quality service.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with change management and deployment cycles.
‚Ä¢ Nice-to-have: SQL query writing for reporting.
‚Ä¢ Nice-to-have: Experience in high-volume or recurring report generation.

Why Recruit Action?

Recruit Action (agency permit: AP-2504511) provides recruitment services through quality support and a personalized approach to job seekers and businesses. Only candidates who match hiring criteria will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst, Global Client Experience Centre
Description:
Requisition ID: 233086

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

The purpose of this role is to support the data and analytics job at Scotiabank‚Äôs Global Contact Centres in developing ELT/ETL pipelines to support advanced analytics (AI / ML) capabilities. The primary focus of the role is to work with the Customer Insights & Analytics Team and the Global Data & Analytics Team in conducting ad hoc data analyses, developing data pipelines on airflow to collaborate cross banking team and assisting the MIS & Reporting team with designing and evolving departmental reporting platforms and infrastructure.

Is this role right for you? In this role you will:

Collaborate with stakeholders to develop BI solutions to address operational needs


Combine multiple data sources across all contact center platforms and applications to build end-to-end BI products
Define metrics / KPIs and develop customer insights models
Assist MIS & Data Analytics team with architecture and infrastructure design / development
Apply analytics tooling, scripts, and methodologies to find actionable insights, build operations models & frameworks, and provide strategic recommendations
Develop ETLs on both On Prem and Public Cloud for analytics solutions using Python, Spark, DBT, Airflow, Bigquery, SQL, and Power BI
Produce ad hoc analyses, deep-dives, and drill downs on specific issues, topics, or areas of opportunity (e.g., process improvements)
Prepare reports and presentations to communicate findings to stakeholders
Assist in coaching / developing / up-skilling peers for advanced analytics
Streamline, enhance and automate existing products to create capacity for team to develop new solutions


Skills

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We‚Äôd love to work with you if you have:


3+ years business intelligence, analytics, data engineer or data science
2+ years business analysis or direct client relationship role
3+ years reporting, UI design, and BI solutioning
3+ years professional data analysis skills and development skills, and github skills
3+ years using python for data analysis and analytics (Pandas, Numpy, Notebook, etc.)
3+ years using SQL for ETL and data analysis, flexibility on syntax (SQL server, PostgreSQL)
collaboration skills with ability to translate technical knowledge into business value
Experience with data modelling, data warehousing and database design
Experience with Python application development, package management, dependencies, and deployment
Experience and understanding of NLP methodologies and tooling
Experience with UNIX tools and shell scripting
Hands-on experience with Big Data ecosystem tools (e.g., Hadoop, Hive, Spark, BigQuery) and object storage (e.g., blob, MinIO)
Experience with Docker, CI/CD tools, and Airflow and Kubernetes an asset
Knowledge of strategy optimization leveraging operations research principles an asset
Experience with cloud architecture (GCP, Azure, AWS) an asset
Contact center experience an asset
Experience with telephony data (Avaya, Genesys) and WFM data (Verint, Aspect) an asset
French and / or Spanish fluency an asset


What's in it for you?


Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.
Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance.
Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
Dynamic Ecosystem - Free tea & coffee, universal washrooms, and lots of space for team collaboration.
Community Engagement - We offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons.


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Product Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Product Data Analyst




Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work¬Æ Institute and recognized as a ‚ÄòCool Vendor‚Äô and a ‚ÄòVendor to Watch‚Äô by Gartner.




Please visit Fractal | Intelligence for Imagination for more information about Fractal.




Position Overview:

Fractal is seeking an experienced and highly influential Senior Product Data Analyst. This is a client facing role where you will be a key strategic partner to product managers, engineers, and designers, using data to shape the future of our client‚Äôs products. You will be responsible for defining and analyzing metrics that measure success, conducting deep-dive analyses to uncover critical insights and opportunities, and driving a culture of data-informed decision-making. The ideal candidate is a master of their craft, possessing deep technical skills combined with strong business acumen and the ability to translate complex data into a compelling narrative that inspires action and drives product strategy.




Roles and Responsibilities:

Strategic Product Partnership:

Act as the primary data science partner for a core product area, influencing product strategy and roadmaps with data-driven insights.
Define and own the key performance indicators (KPIs) and measurement frameworks to evaluate product performance, user engagement, and the success of new features.
Lead proactive, in-depth analyses to identify and size new opportunities, understand ecosystems, and model the potential impact of product changes.
Translate ambiguous business questions into structured analytical problems, delivering actionable recommendations that drive tangible business outcomes.




Advanced Analytics & Experimentation:

Design, execute, and analyze complex A/B and multivariate tests to optimize user experience, drive growth, and validate product hypotheses.
Develop sophisticated statistical models (e.g., predictive, clustering, causal inference) to understand user behavior, segmentation, and lifetime value.
Conduct deep-dive investigations into user journeys and product funnels to identify pain points and areas for improvement.
Build and maintain robust, automated dashboards and reporting systems to provide visibility into product health and performance for stakeholders at all levels.




Technical Leadership & Mentorship:

Champion data best practices and raise the bar for data quality and analytical rigor across the organization.
Collaborate with Data Engineering to design and build scalable, high-quality data pipelines and data models that support analytical needs.
Mentor junior analysts and other team members, providing guidance on analytical techniques, experimental design, and technical skills.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and broader cross-functional teams, effectively communicating the "so what" behind the data.




Mandatory Technical Skills:

Expert-Level SQL: Demonstrated mastery of SQL for complex querying, data manipulation, and performance optimization across large, complex datasets.
Statistical Programming: High proficiency in a statistical programming language such as Python (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn) or R.
Data Visualization & BI Tools: Extensive experience creating impactful visualizations and dashboards using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar.
Experimentation & Statistical Analysis: Deep understanding of experimental design (A/B testing, multivariate testing), statistical significance, and causal inference techniques.
Data Modeling: Experience with data modeling concepts and working with data warehouses (e.g., BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).




Mandatory Non-Technical Skills:

Strong Product Sense & Business Acumen: A deep curiosity and ability to understand the "why" behind user behavior and connect data insights to business goals and product strategy.
Exceptional Communication & Storytelling: The ability to distill complex analytical concepts into clear, concise, and compelling narratives for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Leadership & Influence: Proven ability to influence and lead without direct authority, driving consensus and action from cross-functional teams and senior leadership.
Strategic & Critical Thinking: The ability to think strategically, solve ambiguous problems, and move from data to insights to actionable recommendations.
Autonomy & Proactiveness: A self-starter who can manage complex projects from inception to completion with minimal oversight.




Education Qualification and Certifications Required:

Bachelor's, Master's, or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.
5-7+ years of experience in a data analytics or data science role with a significant focus on product analytics.
A strong portfolio of projects demonstrates the ability to use data to drive product decisions and business impact.




Pay:

The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Fractal, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is: $80,000 - $140,000 CAD In addition, you may be eligible for a discretionary bonus for the current performance period.




Benefits:

As a full-time employee of the company or as an hourly employee working more than 30 hours per week, you will be eligible to participate in the health, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability plans in accordance with the plan documents, which may be amended from time to time. You will be eligible for benefits on the first day of employment with the Company. In addition, you are eligible to participate in the Company 401(k) Plan after 30 days of employment, in accordance with the applicable plan terms. The Company provides for 11 paid holidays and 12 weeks of Parental Leave. We also follow a ‚Äúfree time‚Äù PTO policy, allowing you the flexibility to take the time needed for either sick time or vacation.




Fractal provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

At Fractal, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. As a full-time employee of the company or as an hourly employee working more than 30 hours per week, you will be eligible to participate in the health, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability plans in accordance with the plan documents, which may be amended from time to time. You will be eligible for benefits on the first day of employment with the Company. In addition, you are eligible to participate in the Company 401(k) Plan after 30 days of employment, in accordance with the applicable plan terms. The Company provides for 11 paid holidays and 12 weeks of Parental Leave. We also follow a ‚Äúfree time‚Äù PTO policy, allowing you the flexibility to take the time needed for either sick time or vacation.


Fractal provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Digital & Data Business Analyst
Description:
Position Title: Digital & Data Business Analyst

Position Type: Regular - Full-Time

Position Location: Toronto HQ

Requisition ID: 36535

In every role, McCainers are ambitious, curious, and passionate about creating exceptional work experiences - together. With a customer-first mindset, we make doing business with McCain easy.

About The Role.

McCain has embarked on a digital transformation journey. In the past 3-5 years, global digital systems have been implemented and enable to capture lots of data from our growers and their fields. As part of this transformation, we are elevating the way that we use digital & data to drive value and enhance decision-making across our global agriculture business. Our key objective is to transform data into actionable insights and effective action plans.

McCain is an international company with a world-wide presence, with sourcing taking place in multiple key regions such as North America, South America, Europe, India, Australia-New Zealand, South Africa. Within agriculture, there are some regional specificities and nuances which make the work more challenging. This position of Global Digital & Data Business analyst will focus on McCain Grower Relationship and Sourcing activity pillar, working closely with our internal regional teams and their grower partners.

We are seeking a curious, creative and innovative data-driven individual with a proven background in analytical thinking, problem solving, and communication skills.

The Global Agriculture Digital & Data Business Analyst will play a key role in integrating a data perspective into our agriculture business processes to drive sustainable raw supply, cultivate grower relationships, and enhance sustainability and re-generative practices. This role will be key to transform our agriculture business to be a data-led business around the world. You will work with cross-functional and - regional teams, as well as our technology team to support the digital transformation roadmap. This role will focus on building operational metrics, operational reports and processes to leverage data for actionable insights and ensure decision-makers in Grower relationship and Sourcing can make data-driven decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing.


Define the right process indicators to drive improvement actions that are aligned with McCain‚Äôs Agriculture efficiency goals.
Map the data points that are required to calculate performance indicators.
Act as a global GRM (Grower Relationship Management) data lead to ensure consistency and standardization of key business data. Be the custodian of the GRM business data model.
Serve as a data subject-matter expert on GRM & sourcing business processes.
When global digital systems are implemented collaborate with the global technology and analytics team to identify data sources and ensure a seamless process for accessing the right data points.
When global digital systems are not implemented, collaborate with our regional teams to define ways to track data points in a business acceptable manner.
Propose with the Global Product Manager in charge of this pillar, the analytics and reporting strategy through PowerBI dashboards and standard reporting tools.
Design and oversee the development of intuitive, user-friendly operational dashboards that meet business needs and drive continuous improvements to increase user engagement and adoption.
Develop wireframes of analytics outputs to ensure alignment of business requirements.
Support user training and adoption of reporting tools.
Build regional business relationships to identify value-driven analytics.
Distill data to share actionable operational insights with global and regional Ag stakeholders, including GRM agriculture scorecards. Be prepared to improve data literacy across all regions.
Work with the Data Governance team to identify and support resolving data quality issues at the source and in a timely manner.
Lead medium-scale data-driven projects, in its scope of responsibility, closely collaborating with the technology, analytics and regional teams.


What You‚Äôll Need To Be Successful.


Educational background: a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data & Analytics, or a related field. A master's degree can be a plus.
Data Analysis: experience with data analysis, business data modeling, and data visualization tools. Familiarity with SQL and other data query languages is an asset.
Power BI: 2+ years of hands-on experience with Power Bi will be a plus.
Project Management: experience in project management methodologies such as Agile or Scrum.
Communication: excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with stakeholders at all levels. Comfortable working with business stakeholders across a range of data and analytics experience.
Experience in conducting business process owner interviews, facilitating requirement gathering sessions, documenting functional data model, and creating user stories.
Ability to translate technical concepts into business language.
Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical thinking to identify business needs and propose effective solutions.
Experience working in a regional (multi-country) or global role.
Familiarity with the food/agriculture industry, as this can help in understanding specific business requirements and processes.
Customer focused, collaborative, entrepreneurial, and have a result driven mindset.
Aware of data best practices and able to identify areas of opportunity.
An excellent communicator, with the ability to translate business needs into data solutions.
Accountable and have a ‚Äúget things done‚Äù attitude. This role is about supporting change, finding solutions and getting your business leaders the data they need to make informed decisions.
‚ÄúHands-on‚Äù with data mapping, dashboard design, and working with the technology team to deliver on data initiatives.


About McCain.

Click Here to learn more about McCain and how we provide you with opportunities to make an impact that matters.

Leadership principles.

At McCain, our leadership principles guide how we engage with customers, collaborate as a team, and achieve success. We focus on understanding customer needs, driving innovation, empowering people, and taking ownership to clear obstacles and deliver results.

The McCain Experience.

We are McCain. This statement is a testament to our collective strength and our individual value. Your contributions play a vital role in our success. Our winning culture is rooted in authenticity and trust, empowering us to bring out the best in one another. Here, you‚Äôll find opportunities to learn, grow, and thrive. Join us and experience why we‚Äôre better together.

Compensation Package: $58,800.00 - $78,500.00 CAD annually + bonus eligibility

The above reflects the target compensation range for the position at the time of posting. Hiring compensation will be determined based on experience, skill set, education/training, and other organizational needs.

Benefits: At McCain, we‚Äôre on a mission to create a winning culture that puts employee safety and wellbeing at the heart of what we do, every day. We understand and appreciate that each person‚Äôs needs are unique and ensure our benefits & wellbeing programs reflect that. Employees are eligible for the following benefits: health coverage (medical, dental, vision, prescription drug), retirement savings benefits, and leave support including medical, family and bereavement. Wellbeing programs include vacation and holidays, company-supported volunteering time, and mental health resources. Coverages are aligned to country, provincial and state governing plans and can vary by work level, location and nature of the role. Additional benefit details available during the application process.

Your well-being matters to us, and we‚Äôre here to provide you with the necessary resources to support you in being your best self at work ‚Äî and at home.

McCain Foods is an equal opportunity employer. As a global family-owned company, we strive to be the employer of choice in the diverse communities around the world in which we live and work. We recognize that inclusion drives our creativity, resilience, and success and makes our business stronger. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.

McCain is an accessible employer. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials or accessible meeting rooms), please let us know and we will work with you to find appropriate solutions.

Your privacy is important to us. By submitting personal data or information to us, you agree this will be handled in accordance with McCain‚Äôs Global Privacy Policy and Global Employee Privacy Policy, as applicable. You can understand how your personal information is being handled here.

Job Family: Agriculture

Division: Global Agriculture

Department: Transformation Office

Location(s): CA - Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Company: McCain Foods (Canada)

  • Design and oversee the development of intuitive, user-friendly operational dashboards that meet business needs and drive continuous improvements to increase user engagement and adoption.
  • Develop wireframes of analytics outputs to ensure alignment of business requirements.
  • Support user training and adoption of reporting tools.
  • Build regional business relationships to identify value-driven analytics.
  • Distill data to share actionable operational insights with global and regional Ag stakeholders, including GRM agriculture scorecards. Be prepared to improve data literacy across all regions.
  • Work with the Data Governance team to identify and support resolving data quality issues at the source and in a timely manner.
  • Lead medium-scale data-driven projects, in its scope of responsibility, closely collaborating with the technology, analytics and regional teams.

What You‚Äôll Need To Be Successful.

  • Educational background: a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data & Analytics, or a related field. A master's degree can be a plus.
  • Data Analysis: experience with data analysis, business data modeling, and data visualization tools. Familiarity with SQL and other data query languages is an asset.
  • Power BI: 2+ years of hands-on experience with Power Bi will be a plus.
  • Project Management: experience in project management methodologies such as Agile or Scrum.
  • Communication: excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with stakeholders at all levels. Comfortable working with business stakeholders across a range of data and analytics experience.
  • Experience in conducting business process owner interviews, facilitating requirement gathering sessions, documenting functional data model, and creating user stories.
  • Ability to translate technical concepts into business language.
  • Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical thinking to identify business needs and propose effective solutions.
  • Experience working in a regional (multi-country) or global role.
  • Familiarity with the food/agriculture industry, as this can help in understanding specific business requirements and processes.
  • Customer focused, collaborative, entrepreneurial, and have a result driven mindset.
  • Aware of data best practices and able to identify areas of opportunity.
  • An excellent communicator, with the ability to translate business needs into data solutions.
  • Accountable and have a ‚Äúget things done‚Äù attitude. This role is about supporting change, finding solutions and getting your business leaders the data they need to make informed decisions.
  • ‚ÄúHands-on‚Äù with data mapping, dashboard design, and working with the technology team to deliver on data initiatives.

About McCain.

Click Here to learn more about McCain and how we provide you with opportunities to make an impact that matters.

Leadership principles.

At McCain, our leadership principles guide how we engage with customers, collaborate as a team, and achieve success. We focus on understanding customer needs, driving innovation, empowering people, and taking ownership to clear obstacles and deliver results.

The McCain Experience.

We are McCain. This statement is a testament to our collective strength and our individual value. Your contributions play a vital role in our success. Our winning culture is rooted in authenticity and trust, empowering us to bring out the best in one another. Here, you‚Äôll find opportunities to learn, grow, and thrive. Join us and experience why we‚Äôre better together.

Compensation Package: $58,800.00 - $78,500.00 CAD annually + bonus eligibility

The above reflects the target compensation range for the position at the time of posting. Hiring compensation will be determined based on experience, skill set, education/training, and other organizational needs.

Benefits: At McCain, we‚Äôre on a mission to create a winning culture that puts employee safety and wellbeing at the heart of what we do, every day. We understand and appreciate that each person‚Äôs needs are unique and ensure our benefits & wellbeing programs reflect that. Employees are eligible for the following benefits: health coverage (medical, dental, vision, prescription drug), retirement savings benefits, and leave support including medical, family and bereavement. Wellbeing programs include vacation and holidays, company-supported volunteering time, and mental health resources. Coverages are aligned to country, provincial and state governing plans and can vary by work level, location and nature of the role. Additional benefit details available during the application process.

Your well-being matters to us, and we‚Äôre here to provide you with the necessary resources to support you in being your best self at work ‚Äî and at home.

McCain Foods is an equal opportunity employer. As a global family-owned company, we strive to be the employer of choice in the diverse communities around the world in which we live and work. We recognize that inclusion drives our creativity, resilience, and success and makes our business stronger. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.

McCain is an accessible employer. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials or accessible meeting rooms), please let us know and we will work with you to find appropriate solutions.

Your privacy is important to us. By submitting personal data or information to us, you agree this will be handled in accordance with McCain‚Äôs Global Privacy Policy and Global Employee Privacy Policy, as applicable. You can understand how your personal information is being handled here.
